hWbNO53T3ZMjhXF4Bicflw.text: I've come here with groups after work and happy hour on my birthday.  It's a nice lunch hour that makes you feel like you aren't working, and the rest of the day goes by fast because of it.  We'll get a cheeseboard, yellow tail tostatas, lil street tacos, and my work wifey loves the adult grilled cheese.  Other times we've gotten the olive bites in this aioli thing,  sliders, random cocktails.    They have this gluten free chocolate raspberry ganache cake and illy coffee.  It's the perfect after dinner dessert.  I'd rank this as the best lounge, small bites option in Town Square.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gluten free chocolate raspberry ganache cake
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Rbp4JJcCIQFnNxSttXVYVw.text: Had two flights, the around the world and the Riesling to live. They pour 2.5 oz per three glasses which at first I thought was kind of overpriced but the pours were enough to get a buzz going. Great atmosphere and had the steak frachos which were amazing. The patio is covered and dog friendly. Cigars are available and the cheapest is around $10. Overall it was a pleasant experience and I shall return. It is a bit pricey, but I'm from San Francisco so in retrospect it's a decent enough deal here to return.

wp6P35H-hOGCSiNQXTaWMw.text: I love this place, seriously. The drinks are expertly crafted, and the appetizers are absolutely to die for. Try the goat cheese, roast duck or arancini. You won't regret it. My favorite drinks are the Blood and Sand and the DH Manhattan. But seriously, I have never had a bad cocktail here, so order whatever sounds good to you and I'm sure you'll love it.   Only downside is it's a tad pricey, but it's worth the money without a doubt. Also, it's a cigar bar as well. So steer clear of the patio if you can't stand the smell of smoke.

Zq6iE_yjuL3FVggePnAxFg.text: Wow. This place is bomb.com...Stopped here for HH before a movie. Jessica was bartending and was so awesome. Even the bar backs were attentive and kept my water filled. Great drinks and great food! Even the regular menu prices are reasonable! Creative flights from wine to scotch and bourbon. Will have to try that next time. Every day of the week has a different special! Coming here from now on for food and drinks! Thanks for a great first impression Double Helix! See ya soon!

1O2KafR6HSu9Ha-isor7Lg.text: This is a great location. Definitely different than the Strip location in the Palazzo. It's still on the small side, but offers a happy hour and a menu. The food looked and sounded delicious. The happy hour was a great deal. It was crowded-ish, but not overwhelming and it wasn't too difficult to get a seat. The bartender was very nice and knowledgeable. All in all, my initial experience at this location is enough to being me back. And next time, I'll be eating here too.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whiskey flight ($20) and truffle fries ($6).
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FXmCpROPdVTrm2Lj77A4og.text: I really like this place. I've always sat at the bar and the bartenders are very friendly and extremely knowledgeable. They do a nice happy hour. I like their selection of scotches and cheeses, the eggplant hummus is delicious. French fries with spicy ketchup are also yummy, but I wasn't super impressed with the Arancini. More dessert options would be a definite suggestion. This is a great place for me to go to catch up with my girlfriends, we always end up staying (and drinking) for way longer than anticipated :)

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qQHhxiQIV3krjo0xP5WHng.text: Love it here!  The atmosphere is fun and the people that work there are so nice.  The food is excellent, we always get small appetizer portions so we could try everything.  The lobster tacos and the tuna are my favorite!  Everything on the menu is good :)

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NO meatballs like in Flemings drinks! :)

eLXsecrdy7wSV8Eau_VWRQ.text: This review is for their specialty drinks.  The bar at Yard House had reached its maximum occupancy when my friend and I came down for a few drinks one evening, but fortunately right next door is the Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge.   +Lucky Ray: This fruity concoction consists of pineapple juice, schnapps, grenadine, and Riesling. Fans of sweet drinks might enjoy this cocktail.   +Riesling: I'm not sure what brand of Riesling I ordered, but this one had a slight sweetness.  +Garden Cucumber Martini: Made with gin, basil, and cucumber, my friend ordered three of these for herself; she loved it, but I didn't.  The Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge is laid back and chill in comparison to its neighbor Yard House. Based on my experience, it appears to be a decent place to have a drink or two if you want to avoid the crowds.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lucky Ray.
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden Cucumber Martini.

9rubwvBcocWLMab-2khJqA.text: This place is pretty rad. I had bookmarked it when I first moved here and finally got a chance to check it out last weekend with an out of town guest. Isn't that how all  good stories start? "So my friend was visiting from out of town and...". I think so.   We went for Happy Hour and I was quite pleased with the experience. They really do have an amazing list of whiskey and wine to choose from. I felt a little frazzled, but that's just because I`m neurotic. We opted for some vino; red for her, white for me, and some of their fellini fries(parmesan, truffle aioli, parsley, do it!). The wine was good and those fries hit the spot. I wanted to marry them right then and there.  Service was really good. The girls were friendly and attentive. I felt like we always had water and it was the perfect balance between checking in on us and going away so we could enjoy ourselves. The place itself is really cute and has an inside lounge area with a bar and an outside patio with comfy chairs and couches. Bathrooms are clean and stocked.  Overall, I would definitely come back here. I am waiting for another out of town guest to start a story with.

FjP00CwPkDHN3aRfi1GU-w.text: Make it a DOUBLE!!!!  Stopped in Double Helix before an evening of shopping to grab a drink. Me and my friend walked in and sat down. I had been in once before during their happy hour and it was packed. Luckly this time we got to sit right down at the bar and it was still happy hour. My friend knew exactly what she wanted, the sangria. I however had no idea what to order. It's a whiskey lounge but I'm not a huge whiskey drinker. I decided to take a look at their specialties. I saw a drink and it had the name Lucky in it so I said i'll have that. I then read on to find out it had riesling, peach schnapps, pineapple juice, and grenadine. the full name was Lucky Ray. Not a huge fan of wine but hell the rest of it sounds good. It came in a cocktail glass and i felt fancy as f@$%! It was also a delicious mix. I was really glad I stopped in. Hope to go back after a movie and grab another one.

fWI5oI0zWZoV0DpmaCKqmA.text: Love this place! Service is on point, drinks are awesome and brunch - hello $20 all you can drink mimosas! My favorite spot in Town Square for cocktails and a bite.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Blend Flight

-YqtnKj-X6XE_P7X1X5oCQ.text: Great place to hang out with friends, drink wine and kill time! They have many wine varietals mostly from California regions, Sonoma/Napa. I tried a Mollydooker Shiraz from Australia among several other reds and whites from Duckhorn and other various wineries throughout Sonoma/Napa. All fantastic wines.  The servers weren't very knowledgeable about the wine menu though I must say.   Whether your choice of poison is distilled or fermented, Double Helix has a drink for you. I'll be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert menu I&#39;m anxious to try next time.
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great atmosphere!

yDIomYPrK9lXhcXYgE7FxQ.text: Worst service in the world.... Waitress sat down at our table. We asked a simple question and she just shrug her shoulders and said "beats me, but you'll only be here for an hour..." Referring to us walking in at 9:30 and they closed at 11:30. Got one round of drinks and she never came back. We asked the bar back for our check. And while we waited we had cockroaches pass us by. Disgusting!

p0eeXaHWVHSMxYq9w-_Mkw.text: This place is awesome.  Great whiskey bar in a great location.  Happy hour is pretty good.  Drink and food specials from 330-730 daily.  The service here has always been great and this is my go to when I wanna glass of scotch or bourbon.  They also have a good selection of cigars that are very reasonable priced.  As night time roles enjoy the patio with a cigar and a nice glass of scotch.  They will cut and light your cigar with you so again top notch service.

b6jlKfwkWzoMKAF1X8Tajg.text: It was okay it's more  of a low key place, also  our waitress although she was sweet took  forever to come  and check on us, and it was not that  busy.

zenuUCEetM1aWsMKzfKsrw.text: I was visiting from L.A for a little weekend r&r with family when my brother in law decided to give this place a shot. The whiskey, the wine, the food were just perfect! We did a lot in our stay, this place counted for two of those things...couldn't resist coming twice before the fun was over...

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the flight of wine...wish I remembered which one but it was soooooo good!

AkoCFElWLtqJg8eSTeWcqQ.text: The food here has been great in the past and we have really loved it but we will NEVER go back. They are infested with roaches. There was one crawling up the wall right next to me as we were eating!! Disgusting!! I had the waiter kill it. Then he said they are having bug problems and he apologized. That's not enough!!! I wonder how many bugs have crawled into the food and kitchen area! We should not have had to pay for our food. All he said was they are spraying twice a month. Not good enough! It needs to be shut down! Don't eat here! Who knows what else is going on there!! So gross. Very poor service.

nstPmJ1GnKZBVQ12Z8Bn-g.text: Happy hour menu from 3:30-7:30 is great. Sangria carafe for $14, tapas for $4-7. Sangria is rimmed with cinnamon and sugar, yum! There is an entire huge page of the menu dedicated to their whiskeys. Really good service and a chill vibe... Mostly locals. It's tough to find so look for Gameworks; it's right in front of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour Menu
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sangria Carafe $14 during happy hour 3:30-7:30 carafe was full when we started :)

WGcAcfKt30iN9PiAAqXr8Q.text: Went on a Friday night and it wasn't too busy, thankfully. Had "A Riesling to Live" enjoyed it very much. Jessica served us and was attentive and very nice! Had the Prosciutto and the Rustic flatbread, which were pretty good! The atmosphere was nice and relaxed. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;A Riesling to Live&#34;

G2PlBpfy8XuC4kfmK4UgRQ.text: Fun little hole in the wall at town square. There are misters on the patio if you can endure sitting outside. Love the happy hour got a carafe of sangria for 15$, great prices, attentive and kind service, the tuna dish on HH is really good with some spice! Will be coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The tuna dish on HH with sangria. They line the glass with cinnamon, never tried it but AMAZING:)

oNfOe6fNAyfuF213InljEg.text: Love this bar and restaurant! The staff and owner are amazing. Always go on Wednesday! I hope this place continues to be an option for professionals in the Las Vegas valley.

0kuyjf6wpb6RnYk51h6xsg.text: A favorite for the food but the service sometimes sucks. The last time they were exceptionally rude and refused to turn down the volume on the speakers and television even after multiple people complained. No one was watching it or listening and it only impeded in conversation. If you're clients complain you should probably listen!

DQhAaEACfEJtyJF22-n5Ww.text: Cool chic atmosphere for happy hour dining. Dark interiors but comfy outdoor area with a nice firepit. Happy hours pretty cool and some great wines and whiskeys. FYI the wines on happy hour come as a small pour for the small price, the same with the apps. Still worth a trip though, especially if you're into cheese and charcuterie.

kxU_4fpPdB4pEOUDLc2ciQ.text: Double Helix is a great place, relaxed low key most of the time and can also get pretty loud as the night goes on. The bartender was great and friendly.

DpGgP1T_JBowBRanv2g_hA.text: I have only been here a few times, but the food was good and great whiskey selection.  The wine selection look nice but I go to other locations if I am after wine.  Staff has always been great, dealt with a manager once, and he wentout of his way to make sure everything was exellent.  The patio ara is great.

RS5gl5cFqQKk0fLyQno3iQ.text: I really like this place.  The food is very good.  Brunch is a lot of fun and I love the fact you can have your dogs on the patio.  My only reason for a lower rating is the regular price of some of their wines is a little high.

NKyyEVDjuFr5pbSppsdAcA.text: Cool decor, it's nice how the doors open onto the front and the little fireplace outside is a nice addition.  The music they played, which was very loud techno, that you have to yell over  (why do places play music like that??)  which did not go with the atmosphere. More mellow-type music would go better.  Least favorite thing was how expensive the drinks were.

Dy_dGwjoBBdQbeQ0ax-uHQ.text: It's a cute bar, been there twice before with no issues. Went there recently and I lucked out by getting the most critical bartender. My license had recently expired, less than two weeks and I was refused service cos of it. The law gives you a 30 day grace period but I guess they create their own laws here. Haven't had trouble anywhere else and I use the same ID almost everyday. Definitely won't be back

dwkh5_e4f93ybBfRRe8gtQ.text: Although a tapas restaurant, these are REALLY small plates. Like 3 meatballs, or 5 dates. However, the prices are reasonable, the drinks wonderful, the atmosphere is nice (and quiet enough to hold a conversation) and the service is good without being intrusive. This is a great place to start or end an evening.

faJnD5DVtNdOzIV2fh53fA.text: Great wine and whiskey selection to go along with a great happy hour menu. The bartenders are every knowable of the product they carry.

7319KW39_3j52m7BFjQkuA.text: Outside is nice. Wine selection is a little pricey, like most places in Town Square. The whiskey selection is really where it's at, here.

1_iAH3fMaYCTHCXFfd6UBA.text: The food is ok, drinks are good. Service is slooooooooooow. They forget about you in the patio, and you wait a while for the check. Been here twice, two different servers, both slow service. But the place is pretty cool. Too bad.

1pvJqDhI-SaGochLgJYtlw.text: I accidentally stumbled into the Double Helix Lounge over the weekend and I am glad I did. Amazing whiskey selection! The bartenders could use a little more knowledge thrown there way on how to serve whiskey (I had to explain what neat meant) but other than that it's a great place!

vamUdCMiCswLnUvTbOs0RQ.text: The food is delicious! The wine selection used to be better but it's still good. The whiskey selection is great! Just sit at a table because the cocktail waitresses give better service than the bartendenders. The guy who wears a kilt is rude, and one of the girl bartenders (blonde, there for a long time, knowledgeable but ehh) is so fake that it almost ruins your evening. They need to work on caring for their guest because everything else in the restaurant is great. I would recommend this place though.

abcvnzNIcxGsbx_pxr5utg.text: Was pleasantly surprised by this place. Great happy hour specials-both food and drink. I definitely recommend the arancini and the hummus. The atmosphere was nice too-casual but adult-like. Very pleasant experience. Will definitely go back. I would've given 5 stars, but the chairs weren't too comfortable.

DUs78XBceeeKPtCOyK8qgw.text: Tapas? Definitely 'no'.  We came here for the wrong reason, hunger.  Thinking they had Bottles & Burger, we thought they would've had a good menu here. Big mistake.  Don't get me wrong, the atmosphere was great, the wine selection was OK, the whiskey choices was amazing, the staff was drop-dead gorgeous... but the food was a joke!  The commercial video I just saw was very misleading. We wanted to start with a couple "One-Handed" appetizers. One was deep fried olives stuffed with chorizos, Olive Poppers. The other was the Arancini.  The waitress came with 2 huge plates, and when she set them down, all we saw was half-a-dozen marbles no bigger then green grapes.  Maybe I'm not cultured enough for the $1.50/olive, but the check didn't come fast enough.  It took some restraint on my friend's part. Our sarcastic attempt to make light of the situation did not amuse him at all. We even had to send back the Nutty Mojito.

TNz_YnZ_vefK3ZImhe9WKQ.text: I agree that the music didn't exactly fit the atmosphere. It's very loungey and comfortable, especially on the patio, which I love. But I do think the atmosphere would have been enhanced if there was more of a variety of music. Something hip and alternative maybe.  Service was better than most places in Town Square and the manager was even checking in with diners to make sure they were enjoying themselves. This is almost an anomaly in Vegas it seems, so I thought that was impressive.  I think that the food is a little pricey for the portion sizes you receive and it's hard to convince myself the $12 is worth it for the martinis with Blue Martini being right up the stairs where I can get 1/2 off just for being in the industry. Happy Hour or some other specials would definitely help get people to return.  Overall, I really enjoyed it and would absolutely go back!

xP_GkzkC8Bvu3JsoWP3fVQ.text: Eh.... It's ok. Caught the tail of of happy hour. The staff wasn't the most attentive. Had to ask for plates, and they didn't check in all that much.  Appetizers were good, but nothing to rave about. I'll give it another shot in order to check out the selections of whiskey & wine.

EugAVjb7FoThWhOF-B-kRw.text: Can I just say that I LOVE THIS BAR?!?  Had the pleasure of visiting Town Square after seeing a show on the strip.  Most of the stores were closed and the sounds coming from the Blue Martini made it seem like more meat market than nightcap, so we opted for the Double Helix.  It seemed like a quieter, more mature crowd on a Thursday night, and we were not disappointed.  Only a few tables were full, along with some folks outside on the patio, but the crowd grew as it got later.  We didn't order food, but loved the cocktail selections.  We settled on a coconut mojito and a Sipping Southern.  Both were sweet, flavorful, and worth a second round.  As a Southern sweet-tea connoisseur, the Sipping Southern would have been better with fresh, homemade sweet tea, but good for a Las Vegas whiskey bar!  The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable, and the customer service was outstanding.  I really appreciated his "glass of water with everything" strategy.  I'll definitely go back on my next visit and sample more of the menu.

L00RkRo7QAflP22ga3fapA.text: So last night a friend and I were looking for a place to eat. We were playing it by ear. So upon walking around town square we came upon Double Helix.  IT was pretty crowded at 830 and were greeted by several hostesses which were extremely polite. We were told there would be a 30 minute wait. SO we went to the bar to grab beer, as we were at the bar one one of the Hostess (Manager baybe) came over to the bar and asked us if we wanted to sit at the bar why we waited for the table.  The bartender was extremely friendly  She then came over and told us our table was ready.. I thought this was a nice touch for them being so busy.  They did take my number to text me when the table was ready, however the personal communication was outstanding.    Upon sitting at our table our server came over and greeted us. We still had our beers so she said she would be back in a few to take our order. We then ordered a few things. The Arrenchini and Lobster mac and cheese were outstanding. As we were eating the server checked on us and even the Owner came to our table a few times. We had a quick conversation with him.... Upon finishing our beers the server came back over to ask if we wanted another drink. we asked her opinion on their cocktails.  She suggested one for each of us.  As we were done eating they removed the plates and the owner came back over and talked to us again about our drinks. My friend likes Irish whiskey so the owner and him talked about a couple and he even brought him a small sip of a Irish whiskey.  Great touch...  As we were about to leave we checked in on Facebook and a couple of our friends were in the area  and commented to meet them. We payed our check and left the restaurant.  We then met our friends and we decided to come back and have another cocktail. We got our same table back and same waitress. The owner came back over and mentioned he was trying to say bye the first time but we left so quick. He came and chatted with us again.  GREAT TOUCH. made us feel at home and this was our first time there.   I do not live here in Vegas but my friends do.. We will be back for sure..  Thanks for a great night.. The service at Helix made our night.  THANKS AGAIN!  GREAT JOB.... Keep it up.

Ak7xJMfo3gjd4q4LZv2SIg.text: Great spot and reasonably priced. I always get Garden Cucumber Martini, very refreshing! And the sangria Martini in the fall... Ultimate fall cocktail yummm! Husband favs: Aviation, last word, and boulevardier. Arancini is sooooo yummy, better than I've had anywhere... just get them trust me, I can down 4 plates in 1 sitting lol. Shortie tacos are super tender. Kyle and Elon make fantastic drinks and are super creative, so if you don't know what to get, tell them what u like and let them make u an awesome cocktail, u can thank me later ;)

F87Wdrzy4hO3m-cONRfomQ.text: Great selection of scotch and whiskey.   The place is a little hard to find but it's not bad at all.   It's worth the effort to seek them out and pay them a visit.   My buddy and I each had a quick single malt before heading out to the airport.   It was well worth the stop.    Good show folks.

n30c4IVBXOk2yPtvy2K2Wg.text: The reason for my 1 star review was the fact that I've been coming here a lot because of the food and drinks. I work in Town square for Tesla and I'm very disappointed for the fact that the bartender would not allow me to drink due to my drivers license being expired a couple days ago because of my birthday despite showing my paper of renewal. I've been coming here a lot with co workers and NEVER been asked to be carded. I'm well over 21 years old and I have the grey hairs to prove that. I understand that this is a normal procedures for most bars to check ID but my message is to the Managers of this restaurant. Please be consistent in asking for IDs for everyone! Because I feel as if I'm being targeted individually due to my race or sexuality by the bartender! There is also a level of compromising with customers as well. No joke my ID expired 3 days ago on my Birthday! My photo looks like me and the ID information are the same that's on the renewal paper. Bars who check ID is to confirm Age and Identity that's it. I would understand if I didn't have my renewal paper on me or an ID that goes with the renewal paper. I will be expressing my frustration to my co workers and the people I meet to avoid coming here in the future.

wlUdDk4g6o2NFLgcPG5qhQ.text: Came here for a girls happy hour and I enjoyed the intimate atmosphere of this spot. Really chill and low key. They offer tiny bites which compliments the drinks perfectly. Staff and management were so accommodating and made you feel right at home. As a local it's nice to go to a place and not feel overwhelmed by tourists. I'll definitely be coming back to try other items off of the menu.

3QwSOsP2Z3okbZah5Fx1WQ.text: I've been here a few times previously, nothing awesome or terrible. Until today. Service was AWFUL. Server would disappear for 30 minute stretches. Screwed up our tickets and took.  So. Long. To figure it out. At least the food runners and bus boys were on top of it. Yeesh.

IuUtalbuPtQ3ZNVF0uuboQ.text: Their weekend brunch is quite the hidden gem. The have all you can drink mimosas, bloody Mary's and sangria all for $20, and unlike other all you can drinks you can mix it up and get all of the cocktails instead of just 1 kind.   Their food is always tasty and very unique. The pest grilled cheese is amazing!   Brooke was fantastic, she was friendly and prompt, and had a great attitude about her. I will definitely be back and sit in her section!

nzl9hgYN3evCSc_P29J4rA.text: Ok, so why only 4 and not 5 stars? Well.... yes they have an extensive list of quality bourbons, whiskeys and, scotch. Yes, they allow you to smoke cigars they even have a limited selection there for sale.  I know this is going to sound petty, but they charge a dollar for an ice ball. Really? Charging for ice.... I bought a sphere set at total wine. It was $20. But ok, I'll pay for the sphere. But they ran out. Yea, ran out of ice balls. And our waitress was inattentive and slow because we weren't the big money table. I'll go back again and see what happens. To be continued....

v7HI_WgXo95-dV8Ywj9ANA.text: (+) Happy Hour M-F 3:30-7:30pm. Aranacini (deep fried truffle risotto balls) are bomb.com. I wish they sold them in buckets for cheap so I can sneak them into the movie theatre. Also liked the brisket tacos! Fan of the $6 Brown Derby cocktail (whiskey, grapefruit, agave nectar) Pretty patio area w/ fireplace. TVs for your watching pleasure. (-) Nice staff but didn't exactly go out of their way to sell their restaurant name. If I'm going to a whiskey & wine lounge, I'd expect to learn or want to try more of it. A little bit on the pricier end for smaller portions of food.

opEzDsPGu62WbrOYN_P0lg.text: Double Helix is my go to spot! It's one of the few places in Las Vegas with great patio seating.  The arancini, yellow fin tuna bites, and the blazin sliders are my absolute favorites. As for the cocktails you can never go wrong with the cucumber martini, or Aviation! They have a GREAT happy hour DAILY!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowfin Tuna Bites - a must have
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumber Martini and Aviation - my two favorites

WmY7LHW-xT3yifajR-eH8A.text: This is a good place to come if you're looking for a good drink. The food though is completely underwhelming. Came here for happy hour, the service was great and the server was friendly. Ordered the hummus, taquitos, helix fries, and the blazin sliders. The hummus was bland and weirdly gritty. Ordered the burgers cooked medium but they were over cooked and dry. The fries tasted like they were covered in butter, which was strange to me. The taquitos were fine. The cocktails I ordered were great though. I can not recommend the food, but they have a really nice drink menu.

ThTjj0gT8Ta_2P3T8H8VWA.text: What a fabulous place for wine and dranks and apps! I would say what I love about Double Helix is their mix of wines as well as a quality wine selection in a easy to find location within Town Square Mall!   Food: everything is tapas style so we decided on the double triple to try meats and cheeses in the double triple and it as amazing to taste different cheeses and lunch meats including the best prosciutto I've had!   Wine: I tried the double helix red blend that is my new favorite wine! Gary tried the Jameson cast free whiskey.   Service: here's the only thing that prevented me from giving 5 stars: our service was good at first and then super slow. The place wasn't that busy so I wasn't sure what happened but another waitress got my second drink and our bill.  Will we be back? Most definitely and I have friends from home who would love it so I'll give it another shot based on drink selection and food alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Double Helix Red blend may be my favorite wine!
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jame-o?
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat! In our double triple: salami, prosciutto, and smoked duck!

dNkzu5giFBZg-BInEWOzJw.text: LOVE the place, drinks, food, atmosphere, staff. Prices are EXORBITANT! It's one of my closest friend's favorite places; so I have been there 3 times. We split a few  appetizers & I had three drinks & it cost me $100! A bit rich for my blood. But definitely delicious!

oJSQZp5a1chITKEPuapuMg.text: We came here for the Happy Hour  Pros: Drinks  Cons: Food The food was very blah... The vegan hummus was under seasoned The blazing sliders were over cooked  The helix fries were underwhelming   Come here for the drinks but don't expect much if you're here for a meal

289CHIgGEL-9BSJnX1T60Q.text: Double Helix & Whiskey Lounge is a nice place to hangout. I was there for happy hour last week. When I was there I had Highland Park 12. They also have Four Roses, Monkey Shoulder, Bulleit Bourbon and Buffalo Trace which I also drink. They didn't have Longmorn 16. I especially enjoy all of the different type of foods.  Enjoy the happy hour but the only time I will come back for a visit is when they start carrying  the Longmorn 16.

vzn9q809ok9mTGUBLBmXNw.text: This place will Whiskey you off your feet.  Town Square is a bit of a hodge-podge. Since it's not too far away from the glitz of The Strip, one side of the street may cater more to tourists -- higher end name brands -- along with a price tag to match. The other side will have eateries, local businesses, neat-o nick-nack shops, and things like parks and splash pads; clearly geared towards the locals.   Double Helix harmonizes the same melody as it's host: there are plenty of items, specials, and pure, unadulterated goodness to please everyone's tastes -- along with a tremendous HH menu. Locals need not be afraid of entering "The Vortex" that Las Vegas Boulevard can be -- the prices are always fair.   The best way to approach a visit would be to grab some of the apps and libations during Happy Hour. Held from 3:30PM - 7:30PM, it includes some solid small plates, such as the wonderfully delicate arancini. This is a MUST for me, literally every single visit. The fried risotto fritters boast a smooth marscapone & roasted mushrooms, which are great on their own. The moment they take a slide through the truffle aioili, they transcend to another level. The crisp outside gives way to the creaminess on the inside. Dragonballs for the appetite!  The Happy Hour menu also offers half priced specials on select wines, whiskeys, and cocktails. The $4 Reisling is quite good -- a nice balance of flavors; not too sweet. The reds are also surprisingly good for the prices. These aren't bottles of Barefoot or a box under the bar.  As if this wasn't enough, they also offer some very nice beer flights with varying degrees of price and quality, and even a three course prix-fixe brunch on the weekends.   Offering several items for several different tastes, Double Helix is cemented as a destination I'll continue to hit!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Why&#39;s it gotta be a BLACK bush? Either way, it&#39;s available, along with many many other whiskey choices.

KeCFjujfze4dTvA-K-bVJA.text: Nice small place off on the main stream. It's got good whiskey and wine selection, plus the small plates are great. I would recommend this place. The waitresses where kind and very n there game. I will be going back plenty of times.

Make sure to check out the half off wine bottles on Monday's. I've looked all over Vegas for a good charcuterie board and this is the only spot I go to now. It's a must for any wine lover!!

wsORt26Crbl0LyaJWzKyDg.text: This review is for 3.5 stars.  I don't like Town Square that much as I typically find it overpriced, but they do have some solid HH deals.  Double Helix has a great HH in terms of timing (from open until 7:30pm).  A HH ending at 7:30pm is almost unheard of in Vegas.  They have a couple of beer and cocktail deals for under $6 and then about 6 appetizers to choose from for around $6-8 a piece.  The drink selection was fine - nothing amazing.  I had the apple cocktail and enjoyed it but wouldn't pay sticker price of $12.  The food was actually pretty average.  Portion sizes were very small so coming here outside HH would probably require at least 3 dishes to suitably get full.  They have a nice whiskey selection and a few tvs to watch the game, but I think Double Helix is a little classed-up; a bar to the tune of Yard House or McFadden's next door is more in my wheel house.

13DUE3Dlm2nv8QxRhYXtoA.text: Great happy hour spent here! The customer care is excellent. Very comfortable vibe. Diverse crowd with a versatile menu. I had photos and accidentally deleted them but the watermelon salad was delicious. Fresh arugula with crisp and seedless melon, blue cheese crumbles and a light but flavorful vinaigrette on a generous plate. Loved the spicy hummus plate too! The pita was perfect and still warm. The hummus should be sold in stores. The veggies were a bit wilted and should have included cucumber and celery but the hummus was so exceptional that it is merely a mention and not criticism. Coming back here every time I'm in Vegas and bringing friends.

NbJy8VSFg-sBo45a0_0eog.text: Everytime I come here for some wine, everything is really good. They got a decent wine selection to choose from. I strongly recommend the Sauvignon Blanc from Chile that they got, it was actually really good. Also, they've got the duck proscuittos which are really tasty as well. The bread that is served with were really good as well- they also refill them for you.   The service is always really kind, and they do not rush you out even after their closing time. I love their patio seating, and they have really good happy hour deals as well. So, if you have not tried this place out, it definitely is must-try.

T2ceeADUX1tbuA_aJb-1sQ.text: I love this place It has become a staple in weekend fun... kyle and Jessica are top notch. Taking the time to make you fabulous drinks but taking the time to teach and tell you about the differences of each drink.... Omg love this place

TZ6X3zWS4Q3wRoyHujd20g.text: Located in the heart of Town Square, this has been a place that I have walked by many, many times. After scanning the scene for a new restaurant to try, we picked this one because of the late happy hour.  The ambiance was really fun. Kinda dark. Kinda mysterious. Enough excitement happening around to sit back and really enjoy the food and drinks. It is definitely a drinks and apps type place and not as great for a sit down meal.  What we got:  The Red Sangria (4 stars): great fresh fruit chunks and refreshing flavor The hummus app (2-3 stars): Very basic hummus plate with pita and some carrots. Hate to say it, but I enjoy Trader Joe's hummus better. The grown up grilled cheese (4 stars): 4 pieces of tasty melted cheese with some extra grown up flavors. Very good! The BBQ Pork Sliders (5 stars): Seriously, these sliders were amazing! So good that we ordered another round of them after all the other food! Great flavor, nice balance of elements, simply delicious.  The service was quick and friendly, and we definitely did not have to worry about getting to our movie on time. Definitely worth the trip!

1Y1fnYsysLJaicVS7N3gMQ.text: I wish I could give it 3.5: it's great but with the caveat of it's great "for Vegas".    Pros: Selection of wines and whiskeys are fantastic.  The bartenders can speak knowledgeably about both.  The food is diverse and tasty.  Cons: The dining service is terrible and definitely don't go if you're at all in a hurry.  The music is also disruptively bad for what should be appropriate for the visual atmosphere, which is very cool.  I've been here ~20 times and I feel like it's the best of what's around.

00yqARda5YjLPIDFGCjU7Q.text: I've been to Double Helix twice now.  I really like this place, but I guess that's obvious as I'm a scotch drinker.  One problem: their prices suck!  I got lucky enough to hit them up last week for happy hour and had some really good food for not too expensive, and their whiskey of the month was a shitty single malt for $6, so that's not bad, but otherwise I might as well just buy a bottle at Total Wine for twice the price of two shots at Double Helix.

PffqTsr061OzVTgyUoWOWg.text: This was a pleasant surprise!  Looking at the menu online after a friend suggest we meet here, I didn't expect too much.  It looks like a lot of other menus in this town.   But when I arrived, service was nice and I was happy with the food and cocktails I sampled.  The Grown Up Grilled Cheese, Short rib tacos and the charcuterie platter were all well done.

zOGk7wGRvXe6FNrZIen4fw.text: My boyfriend and I ate here for a late lunch today at 3:30pm.    Happy hour had just started but we didn't order anything from that menu.  My boyfriend ordered the blue moon braised tacos.  They were delicious! The meat was so tender and juicy.  He also got the bacon sliders, which he enjoyed, but his medium-rare was more like a medium-well.  I got the steak frites, which I loved.  My medium came out perfect & the fries were delicious.  I hated having to share this dish with my boyfriend ;p  Our bill was $36 for the two tapas & one meal (no drinks), so decently priced.  Next time I also wanna try the adult grilled cheese!   The steak and sliders were served on these rock slabs, which I found interesting.  But I would hate to have to be the server carrying those things!  Friendly service, our waters were constantly being refilled (:

vGa1K6drmATVyuTnUT_tbw.text: I like this place and the drinks but the service was HORRIBLE!!!   I will give it one more try but if I get horrible service again I will not return!

xRP5dU4EhGbdRIoFPh9D8g.text: Generous happy hours a good happy hours.  Going from 3:30pm - 7:30pm daily makes it very accessible to most people.  Happy hour specials get you $3-$6 appetizers, $3 beers, $4-$7 wines, ~$5 cocktails, as well as 1/2 off premium well drinks (what's a premium well?) and 1/2 off their whiskey of the month.  After several visits here I've found myself enjoying their grilled cheese and arancini appetizers the most.  Gruyere and smoked ham make for a tasty grilled cheese, and the arancini comes with a good truffle sauce.  The food isn't amazing, but these are the two dishes that I've liked most.  As far as drinks, talk with Jessica if you're sitting at the bar.  She's a good bartender that is always happy to make you a drink based on your mood and palate.  Otherwise, their happy hour cucumber martini is delicious, and made with Hendricks Gin!    Decent food and good drinks make for a nice stop at Town Square.

TCSml1iMJ7NGTRdhDO3CfQ.text: very well done! great place to hang out and enjoy the company. go outside where the bombfire is located to warm up during the winter

ztxD9RaHei1HbXcZuooJug.text: Jessica was working tonight and she has the most professional attitude and some of the best knowledge about wines and whiskeys Ive ever encountered in this area

p5fjmrYVW126pQ0SxcN52w.text: I really dig on this bar.  They have a hip atmosphere, an intense selection of whiskey and wine, and a good selection of food to order that pairs well with the drinks.  The decor is definite high stature.  A lot of plush leather seating, clean tables, and the outside patio has a beautiful fire fixture that keeps you warm on nights when straight whiskey just isn't warming enough.  The drinks menu is well designed, offering explanations of the whiskey and their locations of origin.  This is perfect for those, like myself, that are interested in trying new types and want to learn more about what they're drinking.  There's even a map so you can visualize the area you're drinking from.  The food here was surprising.  During their happy hour, offerings are decently cheap and yet don't take away from the quality.  I often order the prosciutto and cheese platters, and so far its only ever been disappointing once.  Every other time I've ordered it, save the last time, the prosciutto has been high quality and a perfect item option to pair with the high quality liquor.    Minus one star for the last visits food quality, and a small lapse in service where I caught the waitress texting for ten minutes rather than serving the few customers in the place for lunch, I've always been pleased with the service and food quality.  I have, and will continue to bring friends back to this place to enjoy the unique whiskey and food combinations.

eFaqdPZ0U6NDp-CM6sd9xA.text: Went for happy hour.  Decent food-- nothing mind blowing, but tasty nonetheless. The mule, though, is GOOD.  I love moscow mules, and theirs is so refreshing.  The big plus for us was the outdoor patio that allowed our huge dog...and they were super friendly and served him water too.   The seating was pretty cramped, but not a big deal. Love the loungey, relaxed vibe of the restaurant.

ifwe8Xw0XXuQpEUIYzMPNg.text: Walked in.  Hostess asks "for how many?" without looking up from phone.  I ask if they serve weekend brunch, as per their website.  Hostess says "no".  Still no eye contact.  Walked out.

s5MdI9SGDERJoeL3Yjxw7Q.text: Come here pretty often! Great happy hour! Kyle at the bar is awesome and really knows his stuff about whiskey! The flights are the best and the goat cheese app is perfect if you like goat cheese! Smaller portions, but quality stuff!

GcS4fq9UxZ3-S-nxs54SAw.text: I suggested this for a date .. We sat at the bar and service was terrible . Ordered one drink and didn't get acknowledge until our glasses were empty . Went to use the ladies room ( co'ed) I was shocked ! No toilet paper, I had to use paper towels that were all over the bathroom floor and over flowing onto the floor .NO running water . The soap dispenser was turned upside down on the wall . I asked for the manager who was the bartender too. She said she had just heard about and was trying to fix it . I also noticed about 50-60 dirty glasses sitting on the back of the bar ...

2BAhE8uuEAHDkNmUS-FqiQ.text: Was here on Thu/26 Sep about 9:30 pm with my buddy: - It's a tapas restaurant.  I had the $9 meatballs (3 meatballs with a piece of bread).  My buddy had the $11 Italian sliders (there were 2 of them).  Food was pretty good. - We had the $7 Stella draft beer (only beer on tap) that was 16 ounces.  Domestic bottle beers (eg Bud/Light) was $5. - Nice ambience, friendly staff.

GBmdSVsvHvEgpe77R5xVDw.text: This is a great little place if you are looking a few drinks and some apps. The outside sitting area is my favorite place to hang out with friends, around the fire pit. The wine and drink list is impressive. I've been here several times now and the servers are friendly and helpful. I would give this 5 stars if the outside drinking/dinning area was non smoking.

I4G3JYD_hadrVge14F1qXg.text: Nice and relaxed place. Good selection of wines! Good happy hour. Good location at town square. Quiet and private. It's nice when the fire place outside is working. 4.5 I would say! Regularly here.

iclsqdSrsVGoyNo9IY5Avg.text: Love the patio... The bar area can be a little crowded but all in all, positive experience.

6dh6s_QBErJk064TO8CU_A.text: Love the happy hour at this place. Great food, decent drinks and a wonderful atmosphere to boot. Happy hour is every day 330p to 730p . Sitting out on the patio you can enjoy a nice cigar with your libations if you wish. Great spot to people watch

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sipping southern $5 on the happy hour menu!!

yZBPBxPeBcjg70e8tL4Ukw.text: Been visiting this location about once a week for the past couple of months and always had a very enjoyable time.  Our last visit was the exception.    Starting with the horrible attitude of the hostess (shorter, dark hair, glasses) and finishing with the waitress (taller, dark hair, glasses), who completely ignored our party while chomping on her gum, it was a huge disappointment.    After sitting for 15 minutes with no contact from her we flagged her down and asked her if we could order food.  She shook her head yes (didn't even have enough respect to speak to us).  We waited 30 minutes and she never returned to take an order.  We flagged her down again and asked for our check but she never brought it.  We had to ask another employee to bring us our check and then we went to Yard House to eat.  In a town built on hospitality it is a shame that there are people who still don't understand that they are in the "service" industry.  If you don't like taking care of guests then this is the wrong business for you.  The guest is the reason for your work, they are not an interruption of your work.  Hopefully the management will care enough to address the issues because they have a great venue with some staff members who don't care about their business and are costing them revenue.

_PIC4rBH112cDgFzoIQnVA.text: After an afternoon of fun with the little ones at the water park in Town Square, we wanted something of an adult affair.  We had heard about their happy hour extended till 7.30.  We were surprised when they allowed the little ones in so we sat down, ordered happy hour food and drinks.  It wasn't busy for a week day and the server was very tentative and very sweet, the owner even came by for a quick hello, which was much appreciated.  We sat in a booth in the corner of the restaurant, which was perfect considering we had little ones with us. The food was perfect for what we needed and price was on par with all the other restaurants and spots in Town Square. We ordered cocktails and enjoyed ourselves with conversations and the subtle music playing in the back ground.  It's perfect for a quick bite, a brief break from the daily stressors, a girls or boys night out, or a break from shopping. I know it's a whiskey and wine bar but we mainly came in for something quick and simple. Will be back for another quick one! Kuddos!!

wRpogwMxQWz-p_koMCOhtQ.text: This place is awesome. Been here a few times and always get great service in a nice, calm, relaxing atmosphere. One of my favorite places to have a drink. Love it!

HGcsmq4uistGMIJn2vUErA.text: Great variety on the menu. Excellent attentive and educated staff regarding the menu, quality drinks, great atmosphere and well priced. I can't say enough positive comments. Glad to have stumbled into Double Helix.

VhG3gsrcFAAxFNKB0EEGqQ.text: This is our favorite bar/lounge. We've been several times. Wait staff is attentive but not annoying. Tapas are on point. Delicious.

oFuQH6DmF04_I4aNj9ihMQ.text: One of our favorite places at Town Square. Love the patio seating and their happy hour as well as regular menu.  Recently had their new lobster rolls which were really good. The lobster was on a perfectly toasted buttery bread.  Usual favorites are the Steak Frites and the pork sliders.  Also the perfect spot for parents to enjoy alone whine your kids watch a movie across the way at the amc theaters.  Kids get to watch a movie while parents can enjoy some alone time :)

PwxSLlv8yDPOJ1XnURUqOw.text: This place is the shit.  Well at least it used to be.  Many of the people that I came to love have since moved on.  That is life I guess.    The Klinkerbrick is still pretty darn good.

UXG14o-wQ0SUYnxQKrjCIg.text: I recently had my husbands 30th birthday party here.  I called ahead of time reserve the space.  The manager was really pleasant and made sure we had enough space for everyone.  But I really loved our waitress.  Ive forgotten her name but she was wonderful.  I don't know how she handled so many people with different checks. She was on top of everything and always asking how we were doing.  Thank you for making his birthday a great one.

aIdiJvyZe8iC3q4sxV4oAw.text: After a long night on the town, Sunday brunch at Double Helix was exactly what my friends and I needed. Our waitress was friendly and attentive to our needs. (don't remember her name, but she was a good looking blonde). For our small group we ordered a ton of food.  Fried Olives - Tasty Croque Madame - Delicious.  Beef Sliders - Standard Mac N Cheese - Delicious Arancini - Amazing Flat Bread Pizza - Its pizza  Bloody Mary was great, and the girls loved the 20$ bottomless mimosas. It was nice they had the NFL game on. Would definitely go back when we visit Vegas.

C5bfIvMQ5OaT2PYcjgL5SA.text: Definitely NOT happy after this Happy Hour...  FOOD: "Arancini" -Fried risotto balls with mushrooms & cheese served with a truffle aioli  DRINKS: Whiskey of the month (don't remember the name, but it was quite smooth.)  TASTE: *** [The Arancini was deelish! ...the rice balls were fried crispy outside, soft & tasty inside, and the truffle sauce.]  CONVENIENCE: **** [located in the center of the Town Square Mall.] AMBIANCE: *** [Small bar, small lounge area, one large round table... lowly lit.] SERVICE: ** [Friendly, but NOT accommodating to large groups.] PRICE:  $ [$3-6 for small plates, paid $5 for the 1/2 off whiskey of the month] OVERALL: ** [2-stars...  For our group of 10, they somehow added an additional $7 for a drink we didn't order AND after fixing their mistake then adding a 20% tip on top of our bill... each person still ended up paying an additional $2-3 MORE than what each person ordered.  Wth?!  It would have just been easier if they split our checks.]   Decent happy hour deal from 3:30-7:30pm... good for small gatherings. Nuff said.

NqTrBt_OW-rgk3RHR-AeZw.text: I have been to Helix before but it's been a while. So being vegan I checked out the menu online before choosing. Quinoa salad, fall vegetable platter and the hummus I have had there several times and enjoyed. Staff was great. Blonde waitress we had was really good and sweet. Drinks were delicious. But the menu on Yelp not updated. No longer have the quinoa salad or vegetable platter. But there was still hummus! The waitress was smart enough to catch on to my veganism and let me know the chef makes it with chicken broth. WTH???? Never heard of this ever. Hummus is usually safe from animal products. Would love to see some vegan items on the menu and get the chicken out of the hummus or at least have a warning sign.

JcttmHLpmUv-Ov4shWL6-g.text: PROS: -Intimate, comfortable ambiance; this is a great spot to catch up with friends. -Prompt, friendly service.  -Great happy hour specials that run fairly late. -Good selection of drinks and snacks. -Reasonable prices, even after happy hour.  CONS: -In retrospect, I wish that my friend and I had requested that our tapas be brought out together. We didn't realize that she'd get her dish a full 10 minutes before I got mine (we didn't order to share, so it was a bit awkward).   All in all, I can't wait to go back. This is one of the few local lounges that I've really enjoyed.

vKMPNGiDrBhdd8g0KUFF3w.text: Good place to stop by and grab a bite or a drink. There is even Options for the vegan diet.

v4gFnYmmslkGy98i3L2hDQ.text: Visited last weekend and the previous weekend.  The food is good but not amazing. The charcuterie plate was quite tasty, the rest of the items were less impressive (deep-fried olives are interesting but not awesome, and there are more of that ilk on the menu).  Good, but not amazing.  Service was hit or miss over 2 visits.  During the first visit the waitress continually screwed up our order.  They never figured out how to bring out the steak frites that we ordered, and there were random items tacked onto our bill that we never ordered nor received.  We sent the bill back, but eventually, because my table is a bunch of softies, we just paid it and left.    Good location and scene.

QhtoCkUFk6znTCqhUOWfgw.text: For a place that specializes, it really doesn't have the quality of spirits that you expect. This is a great place to kick back with your friends, get plastered, and flirt at the bar. If you are a whiskey connoisseur, you're SOL. in my wild and drinking days, I got quite familiar with many a whiskey and this place doesn't measure up. Their wines are passable. I love a good moscato and malbec. This place has pretty good wines. Loud and noisy, good place to socialize but not to relax with a good whiskey neat.   It's obnoxiously pretentious, but sometimes that's a good thing.

-dht9ew3-5BCjCSuuz9IzA.text: Leaving this review because the service and the drinks were amazing. I've frequented this place over the years, but this is my first time leaving a review. Kyle, the bartender, is one of the best in Vegas! There needs to be a better title, because to call him a bartender is a disservice to what he does because he is not only a magician with the cocktails, he also eloquently lays out what goes into each drink and what kind of taste to expect in such a way that both pleases the veteran drinker and informs the novice. He does this without ever sounding condescending, which is an attitude you see far too often in Las Vegas. My girl and I were pleased to have his expertise and humour, and he's definitely what we'd consider an irreplaceable asset to this particular location! Seeing as how he's been a fixture there for at least the few years I've been going there, the ownership probably agrees with that sentiment. I've honestly never had the food here, so I cannot comment on that. The environment is pleasant and the crowd is pretty good. Never seen any dramas or problems. Great place for a happy hour drink or impress your FarmersOnly date with a big city cocktail list.

Rene4VQedRmbVTT0Ss1SmQ.text: Located inside the Palazzo on the 2nd floor in the middle of the mall, this place was one of our favorite places to grab a glass of Wine or Beer when we lived in Vegas.  During our recent trip back to town, we decided to stop by here for a couple of drinks before we went to The Act Nightclub.  First of all, we were happy to see that it was still in business.  Half of us ordered a glass of Wine and the other half ordered a chalice of Stella.  We hung out for about an hour and enjoyed the people watching.  Since it's located in one of the main intersections of the mall, you can see people walking around in all directions.  There were also several characters hanging out at the bar, which were fun to watch.  If you're looking for a place to have a nice glass of Wine and Beer, give this place a shot.  They also deliver to all hotels on the Strip, so take a look at their Wine menu and if there's a bottle you like, they'll take it to you.  Return Factor - 90%

iqurPd00Zp-gPNyF8BuC1Q.text: This is my favorite bar in town, hands down.  Whether in the mood for a dry cab or a refreshing mojito, this bar always delivers and satisfies!  The bartenders are engaging and the servers are friendly and attentive!    My favorite time to go to Double Helix is at night when the lights are dim, but I also enjoy sitting outside on the patio while absorbing the sunshine in the afternoon.    Note: Double Helix also serves apps too!  My favorite are the olive poppers!

EBSSWVOpzx5p5IVzjLAK5Q.text: I love this place.   I come here occasionally when I'm looking for some awesome whiskey. I'm a big whiskey enthusiast and this is the only place in Vegas that i've found with such a great selection. They have over 50 different types of whiskey and the categorize it by region. If you ask about the different regions the bartenders are able to tell you the differences.   The best thing about this place is they have a whiskey of the month that is half off during happy hour. This isn't like half off Jack Daniels, its high quality whiskey at a great price. They also have excellent food and a great happy hour (3:30-7!). It's more fine american dining type food and atmosphere. I highly recommend the Pork Sliders. The sauce is amazing!  The staff is great as well. I have been multiple times and never had any issues and they've always been very friendly.   I haven't been here for dinner, but I feel I need to go. For whiskey lovers out there, this is your place.

wG5zXplGFg9hqsNSqb_tOg.text: Love this place! I love the amazing whiskey selection here and I love the wine flights. There are a lot of amazing selections and you really can't go wrong. I love the grown up grilled cheese and the arrancini! Tried the the marguerite flatbread for the first time the other day and loved it! Really, all the food there is awesome... I do wish, though, that the serving portions were a little larger because I'm a hungry, hungry lady. The main reason this place only gets four stars from me because the service can be shotty. I love the bartenders and usually get great service at the bar. But, sometimes my group will choose to sit outside and some of the servers are great, but some of them can be pretty rude and take a while. On multiple occasions we've noticed them openly talking about other customers which just isn't cool. Get it together ladies.

Tux42Ioky9J-Mn-Y7mql7g.text: Meh there is absolutely nothing special about this place. Small, plain and simple lil bar. Parking isn't great. Another bad tip from someone.

D0o7TiLzB5nWbPr4Uwa6VA.text: From the reservation to the middle and hopefully the end,  the experience was great.  Fast service,  faster food and great drinks.

TOljhLtOmDisqSNG562yAw.text: My wife, roommate, and I tried this place for the first time Saturday night after our wine walk. The hostess was very sweet and we were seated fairly quickly considering how busy it looked. Our server was nice, we ordered our drinks first. Came out in a timely manner. And then we had a few appetizers.   Ordered the Prosciutto platter (I think it was), and the Bri (if I remember correctly), and the fries. Our server warned us the Bri would take 15min or so to make, which we were fine with. We actually got that first before our basic fries. In fact, we finished it first before receiving our fries. Our server was missing at this point, so I had to ask some random server about our fries. Within minutes they showed up.   We then asked to be seated out on the patio so we can smoke our cigar for the first time. It was nice seating near the fire pit. Our server was attentive now, and showed us how to properly smoke a cigar.   I took off a star because according to our server they were a bit understaffed. Apparently another server was able to leave earlier in the night. My suggestion is DO NOT cut anyone on a Saturday night especially when there is an event going on in Town Square. Aka Wine Walk.   Would I recommend? Sure if in the area. But it didn't leave a lasting impression for me to return.

xWkpU-ahE9O48jqQJu9IcQ.text: Double Helix is the place to be!  I've been looking for a place to relax, drink good alcohol, have great food, and just relax... And double Helix is the answer!  Kyle the bartender is so knowledgeable about all the whisky and Michael the GM is so nice and friendly.. Making you feel like a regular on your first visit..  Of course, I am a regular now!!  A HUGE selection of whiskeys, great cheeses, amazing wines, and a great atmosphere where you can actually talk to friends and not be drowned out by music...  You owe it to yourself to check out double Helix!

dc0TbsPBYm2HrOfrCtZ-UA.text: Cute place and good wine. Staff was friendly and would defiantly recommend to friends.

VdltSwpKDYJtEWxXsBC1Qg.text: We decided to go today before seeing a movie at town Square. We ordered the double helix sangria as it was happy hour and it was one of the menu items at happy hour. I tasted more whiskey than wine and it was more of a whiskey drink than it was a sangria drink. I wasn't that crazy about it. I can also say that I am disappointed about the new happy hour menu of food items which isn't as good as it used to be, but the small shredded beef tacos and hummus plate were good. It is not as good as it used to be and it is not likely that I will come back here again. There are other places to choose from that are much better and many new places that have opened around in that area that I have not tried yet. The service was good and we had a very nice person as our waitress.

k4sU4h91M43iWFe2Msbaxw.text: Everytime we go here my party and I end up getting overcharged for something.    The bartenders end up upcharging you for everything (especially during happy hour).  Even worse, on multiple occasions, drinks have been added to our tab that were not even ours.  I believe these practices come from direct management, so I will not be bringing any more parties or business associates here again.  I believe honesty and integrity is the best policy...not trying to leach money out of people.

ICUqtVZDsGsP5oNzzw1KpA.text: Little difficult to find if you are going to specifically go there, but if wandering the outdoor mall.. it's great.  Good service, decent food. The olive appetizer was amazing (just what I was looking for!!) Plan to go back next time we are in Vegas!

d-9-I_xLZlVMWaGXqyW-OQ.text: Delicious, elegant and relaxing. Amazing food and their whiskey/wine collection is overwhelming. Always fresh and exciting and every bartender I have had has been respectful and super fun to talk too. Great selection.

i2K3QIMH34QVRcRAqAN8rg.text: We stopped by after eating at Yard House. The hostess sat our group of 7 outside by the the non-lit fire pit.  After about 5-10 minutes our waitress came and took our cocktail order. Then about 10-15 minutes later one of our friends got up to ask if our cocktails were coming. About 5-10 more minutes goes by, our waitress arrives with a large platter of cocktails for our party and then a few for other patrons. We continue sipping our drinks, never to see the waitress again. So, we decided to move on.  I personally wasn't too upset that our drinks weren't replenished every couple minutes, but our  friends were definitely annoyed.  Would appreciate better service next time, but whatever.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XcnhruzS5k_8xu3v5GtZqQ.text: DH has been bookmarked forever and my gf and I were glad to find out that they have happy hour everyday from 3:30-7:30. DH has an extensive drink menu, mostly (you guessed it!) wine & whiskey. However their happy hour left my friends and I feeling pretty hungry still.   Happy hour food prices here are a bit high compared to the portion size, but then again DH does serve mainly tapas. We ordered the tacos, 2 for $7. They came out hot with a super soft tortilla and well seasoned pork. I'd definitely order this again if I come back. Most of the food on the happy hour menu is only a dollar or two off their regular menu price so I'm not sure if its worth it. Like other reviewers said, if you come hungry, you'll probably leave hungry unless you spend a lot.   Wine & sangria are about $5. I was hoping that they would have white sangria, but its made with red wine so I passed. Their apple fizz $6, was pretty tasty. The first few sips didn't taste like alcohol at all but towards the end it was pretty strong. The Whisky mule is made with lemon juice. I wish they added some mint to it. Also, I could hardly taste the whisky in the drink... not sure if that's good or bad!  We had some drinks and tacos and decided to head over to lazy dog for dinner. With so many other happy hour spots in Vegas, DH won't be on the top of my list unless I have a whiskey loving friend in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EeBWKZEmUTPAO4B1pJf2Yw.text: I swear I've reviewed this place multiple times. We enjoy going here for a few reasons: They have a great happy hour that I believe goes until 7 P.M. Great for us working folk! The patio is a great place to enjoy drinks, but can be hard to secure a seat on a popular day.  They have a good happy hour menu, but I will say that the menu isn't too extensive or versatile. Don't get me wrong, there are great items to snack on, but if you come here often, I imagine the options get old. Lots of fried things for the happy hour menu. Options aren't too fulfilling if you're hungry.   While I enjoy this place and don't want it to go anywhere, we prefer to come here for happy hour with friends or a before-movie drink, rather than a sit down meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of friend happy hour items. Friend arancini balls (bottom) and  crispy olives with chorizo and goat cheese.

WNO2KU5-Hw4m-033vBp3cw.text: I've been putting off this review in hopes that the poor service I've received here were one-off scenarios, but it's clear that they are not. I really wanted to like this place; the food and drinks are great but this place gets a 1 star for service.   I checked this place out for the first time about a year ago with a friend, and the service we had was terrible. Our server rushed us, proceeded to take my friends order and then WALKED AWAY before I could order my food and drink - what??? So when she finally came back around to my table, I let her know that she didn't even ASK me what I was ordering before she walked away. Our server proceeded to ignore us until we finally had to chase someone else down to close out the check.  Poor experience #2: I came here with my boyfriend about 6 months later after we happened to receive a gift card. I assumed that the crappy experience my friend and I received was a one-off. Towards the end of our meal, our server disappeared AGAIN. We waited and finally flagged her down to order dessert. After ordering with her, we waited a full 30 minutes (no exaggeration) and dessert never came out. Finally, we flagged down another server to let them know we were still waiting. When our original server finally showed up, she explained that the kitchen "messed up on the dessert" and will be another 20 minutes - which is nonsense, it was clear by how flustered she was that she forgot to put our order in. We told her to forget it, we closed out our check and left.  Poor (and final) experience #3: I came here for the last time two days ago with my same friend from my first visit. I had a little left on my gift card and they were having a happy hour, so we figured we would give it a go. I couldn't possibly have bad service 3 times in a row, right? Wrong. We waited about 15 minutes for our server, who we realized was the young blonde who walked in clearly LATE for her shift through the front doors. When we finished our food and drinks, we let her know we weren't ordering anything else and we'd like our check. We waited. And waited. And waited. At this point, my friend and I were laughing. It was the same experience as we've had prior. Finally we had to flag down a different server to close out our check, as ours would literally walk right past our table and ignore us - several times.   I don't know what this business is trying to be. Do the employees think they're too good for everyone else to provide solid, attentive service? Whatever it may be, I'm not coming back, and I hope management sees this and pivots.

0QO93F9T0itHZ6RSGUSM_w.text: A great alternative to the Strip or Downtown watering holes when it comes to "adulting" on a Saturday night, wait... what is "Adulting?"    "Adulting" - Definition: Sipping one or two drinks, staying within your cocktail budget, and using all of your Uber credits for your inebriated friends.   The Double Helix is a great lounge for both snackers and whiskey lovers alike. This spot is located in the main hub of Town Square and they feature over one hundred whiskeys and an entire vineyard's worth of wines, both red and white.    Instead of just staring at their vast drink menu, I suggest going with a "drink flight", this is the best way to find out exactly what you do and don't like and yes, they offer whiskey and wine flights for the indecisive person. They also have great happy hour deals that usually highlight a specialty whiskey or wine. If you really want to get educated on whiskey ask for Kyle, one of the bartenders, he's the hunky guy in the Kilt. The dude is legit when it comes to drink suggestions and whiskey anecdotes.   Hummus, quesadillas, and fried cheese is just a small sample of the snacks they offer here, they also have excellent charcuterie plates to go with that bold red in your hand.   Sip smart Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whiskey Flight.
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6Y_D613l1KPUdAPJYBRFWA.text: This place is the perfect date night spot! Far enough from the strip to feel like a Vegas local, this bar offers a ton of wine & whiskey options! Not to mention their meat & cheese plates are ahhhmazing (herb goat cheese and prosciutto was our fav) & don't pass on the mushroom ravioli either! Service was superb as well!

04fi199NJ6z1ANH-ZK9Oag.text: Great wine and whiskey selections.  Staff was friendly, knowledgeable and professional. Bartender Kyle made the experience top notch by answering all my wine questions - he was upbeat, engaged and knowledgeable... Even with 3rd or 4th questions about which wine or food to select....  Fun environment.  Great location in a nice indoor/outdoor shopping complex.  A great place to go for wine, whiskey, food and cigars... Especially if you want to escape the Strip.  Close to the strip and the airport. Mostly locals too, which I loved. Patio was also nice. Clean bathrooms including one that was gender neutral - which I loved.   I'll be back.

6O1sIhxqy_ke9wvwKx1wBA.text: Covered Patio with firepit was awesome atmosphere for our small group get together!  Center courtyard by YardHouse, easy to find.  Cheese plates AWESOME, all food was excellent ...plentiful & creative drink selection. We all enjoyed ourselves & stayed longer than planned.  5 stars & 2 thumbs up for service.

swwgAcb_LpnsTiIQqOmmrA.text: Not the first time stopping in for a Friday happy hour. Want to thank and compliment our server Sarah! What a sweetness and so attentive!  She was a wealth of information when picking meet, cheese and whiskey.  Charcuterie is always a treat + atmospshere, selection of small plates and beverages is just right. Salude

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tipsy Pig

cZ86sU-4oHocw7cs8l4Wbg.text: I'm giving 2 stars based on the wine and quality of food. Wine was great, a little expensive aside from HH.. food tasted great, but when they say tapas-they mean TINY tapas. But nonetheless that all tasted great.  My main problem is I would give ZERO stars based on service alone. I was meeting a friend around 5:30 and I arrived before she did. The male host who sat me immediately got me waters while I waited. I did not see any waitress for over 10 minutes. Once she came over to me she said "I'm assuming you're waiting for your friends?" I said yes, and she would return once my friend arrived. My friend arrives, and 15 minutes later we get greeted by a very frantic and busy server, who then took our food and wine order. We could tell she was overwhelmed but her lack of knowledge about the menu was unacceptable! I asked for a couple of the sauces listed on the entrees to be placed on the side, and I'm her broken English she said she didn't understand what I was asking. I had to point to the menu and explain what I was asking, she wrote our order down and ran off. Our wine did not get to our table until maybe 10-12 minutes later, they were busy, so that was understandable. But then.. 25 minutes after placing our order, our (frantic) server comes to ask us what we ordered! It arrived about 15 minutes later, so about 40 minutes from initial placement with our server. After a couple hours of visiting, we were ready to close out. My friend and I split the check, she paid cash and I would put the remaining balance on my credit card. This server then proceeded to ask me if I could give her all cash because she "already closed out my table"!! First of all, not my problem. I would have given more cash if I had it, but giving my card I obviously didn't, she then said she would "figure it out" and my card was charged appropriately. But I was appalled that she asked me to give her cash in the first place. From start to finish, AWFUL service from this waitress who's name I regretfully did not get.

UFpUvdszO9vP6udARoCBjA.text: Underrated spot in town square, huge whiskey selection and pretty good food. Our bartender was knowledgable and had no problem answering all of our questions (had quite a few), thank you, Dexter! Highly recommended!

_ILGGalvS-rX6B7k_UgHKA.text: sadly, i drank neither wine nor whiskey here. seems sacrilegious given the name. i shall repent mightily. can't mess up a redbull+vodka since redbull could pretty much cover up the taste of motor oil.  ambiance is decent for sitting in what i could only describe as a glass-less fishbowl.

4jbCqKcy4lvBUI5nWqmWew.text: Word of the wise: go here during their happy hour.  They start from 3pm (?) - 730pm and then the start again later in the night.  Anyway, I was very excited to finally try this place out.  The ambiance was great, it was a big more upscale than the other bars around that area.  Music was tolerable - you can still have a decent conversation.  This is what we had:  Helix (house brand, I assume): Merlot and Pinot Noir ... it was very decent wines that we ordered 3 glasses each!  The food (let me see if I remember)  Pulled pork sliders: Sauce was not overwhelming (ie: messy) BUT they could have put more on the side just so we can add more to our liking.    Fried Olives: breaded perfectly (not oily and totally crispy).  If not mistaken it as kalamata olives.  Compot ACO (I think I got that right): The jams were tasty, wished they added more fruits and the cheese was great compliment to the Pinot I was drinking)  Skirt Steak: YUMMM!  Perfectly cooked for a thin strip of meat - it was still red in the middle - good job!  Hummus: Really liked this one.  Flavorful, not overwhelming and the added fruits (?) in the hummus sweetened up the bite.  The bread was thin and not overwhelming.  Margherita Flatbread: Crust was thin (brunt to a crisp on the sides).  Might want to watch it while in the oven.  The basil was very fresh (last minute addition) which brightened it up really nicely.  Would love more mozzarella.   a Chocolate Cake (I forgot the name): very rich, you can really taste the cocoa and coffee.  It was a great ending to the meal.  I must say, we ate a lot here...

evdM_ZikmQI6lOetLfVo_A.text: Came here for after dinner drinks. Overall cool place to hang out. There was a live DJ which kept the atmosphere fun and hoppin'- definitely catering to the DINK crowd (dual income, no kids). The service was attentive and our drinks weren't empty long before a waitress came to our aid. Lots and lots of whiskey choices from around the world. This was a big hit with my husband. He had a lot of fun trying different kinds. Price is moderate. Did not try the food- but smelled appetizing. Nice selection of finger food to enjoy with drinks.

uhbWMQZt3i8KKoJt0K-Rpw.text: I was incredibly impressed by the food and libations.  After leaving work I needed to wind down and this place was the spot. Happy hour goes until 7 30 and the service is impeccable.  Christina was so helpful and steered us in the perfect direction.

bfsyX_s1MphxhqUjNt5xRQ.text: Came here for happy hour after tasting their food during a mixer in Town Square and realized that the portion sizes for this place is TINY! A bit overpriced for what they offer, but the food wasn't bad ... Drinks were okay, service was okay since they weren't very knowledgeable in some of the wine questions asked.   Overall, food prices are high for small portions, especially if you don't order off the happy hour menu.  But on happy hour it is pretty decent.  Just don't come hungry!

ZGr3eEvxg3Zq2mc3M_QeeA.text: Possibly the best Hendrick's cucumber martini ever concocted - hope to see you still here in 6 mos!!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cucumbers are so healthy here

evVlGVBN-U6XEy6BP1ytzg.text: They have an above -average assortment of wine and whiskey.  The atmosphere leaves little to be desired.  I would go here if my wife was shopping...it's fine if you're a tourist but there are better wine bars and better places in town for whiskey too!

zy7Ugl-g0gvVReZ3Vs-Haw.text: Prices are very reasonable and wine temps appropriate. I love the use of iPads as wine menus! Nice cheese selection, too. A little small inside if you're not interested on sitting on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heirloom Tomato Salad and Bucheron Cheese Platter with Schramsberg &#34;Mirabelle Brut Rosé&#34;

j5BPoe1ZYWyJDqca03Hmig.text: This is a nice place for drinking wine off of the strip but still reasonably close to it; being in Town Square. Also, it is definitely better priced and is bigger than the other location which is in the Palazzo Shops on the second floor right on the strip.  My alumni club hosted a fashionably dress to impress Kentucky Derby party at this venue. The restaurant had a fine selection of wine for our wine junkies and was also able to change up their bar with bourbon offerings such as Woodford Reserve Double Oak for our special event. Mint julips were on point and meals were reasonably priced.

azc8do9dqztyB3TUnuAzYA.text: Great place. Good service. Tasty bar food. Friendly attentive staff. LL Cool J in the background. Life is good!
