UYzUyRz25byCXKREw-fvaw.text: SO many great wine choices here...Love the atmosphere...Great place to catch a drink at Town Square.

O5IAd1_SOvFII6H1CLIvzw.text: Have been comming here after seeing a movie  many times.  Have always had a pleasant experience.  Especially on Monday nights where they have amazing bottle specials.  The food is very good.  I especially like their cheese selection.  The out door seating is an excellent touch.  The owner Ray came over to us and asked how our experience was.   You don't see that too often anymore....  I highly recommend it....

2p4M4PKE1cEhsSlsK3BnPw.text: I had a VERY Jekyll and Hyde experience here in the same day. I was waiting for a friend and saw that their happy hour started at 3:30p, so I went inside. It was a Tuesday, so only a few people were there. Sat at the bar and enjoyed a nice glass of wine and had a very pleasant conversation with the bartender. She recommended that I stop back by later since happy hour ran till 7:30p, and advised that the food was really good.   Around 7p, we were ready for dinner, so decided to swing back around to Double Helix. There was nobody at the hostess desk, nor a sign about whether to wait or seat yourself, so being a nice night, we ventured out to the patio. We sat there for HALF AN HOUR without a single acknowledgement from the server or busboy. No silverware, no drinks, no menus. And not for lack of trying on our parts. Short of tackling the server, she simply had no interest in waiting on our table. It's clear that this place has more interest in hiring hot girls than quality servers.   Upon leaving, there was a petite gal at the hostess desk who thanked us for coming in, but I corrected her and told her that we were leaving because we were ignored for 30 minutes. She just said, "sorry". No mention of calling over a manager, or anything to try to change our minds to stay.  I give 2 generous stars because the happy hour at the bar with the delightful bartender was a nice experience. But that's the only thing I can say about this place. If you're hungry, seriously go someplace else.

vNQev5p7jq-_66Vodxp7HQ.text: If the bartender would stop talking, and pay attention to her work...I'd give it a 4* & I wouldn't be at Brio's!!!

U14NPFMftKV3C-lgVpKwRw.text: Such a gem! I'm a big whiskey drinker, so have been on numerous occasions for adult beverages. Last weekend, a girlfriend and I were looking for a good happy hour besides Blue Martini. I called and found out their happy hour goes until 7:30 pm, yay! So we stopped by and ordered some small plates and adult beverages. I had never had the food prior and was impressed! Will definately be back soon. I will say their couch/love-seat chair seating is very uncomfortable, especially while dining. Good idea, but I would suggest taking those out and putting more small tables in.

76Ry6lxQ4l3PQd5Uccw1YA.text: I have a feeling this place has some HUGE fans, and I suppose I can see why.  Town Square has become a relatively trendy destination for all kinds of people in Las Vegas.  On the surface, a wine and whiskey lounge with a happy hour menu sounds great.    However...  This place seemed pretty confused to me.  There didn't seem to be any real connection to any of the menu items.  The decor was clearly expensive, but not attractive.  Prices were high (it seemed) on whiskey, and their drink special that day was Wild Turkey, which hardly seems special to me.  Waitresses dressed trashy as did the hostesses.  I can see how this might have allure in some contexts, but it just seemed out of place here.  The music was loud and really bass heavy, which would have seemed appropriate if they had a dance floor - but this is just a tiny little bar.  I don't know, maybe I missed something or just didn't "get it". I would probably be willing to give it another chance, but I am currently unimpressed with Double Helix.

U4eGGC-qRAfZewFJdJOqfw.text: Great ambiance, great food, great wine and whiskey selection. Perfect spot for locals to hang out and enjoy not being in a casino.         P.s. Try the meatballs

sKZ7mfbLbz1a17jgXafGCA.text: This is a great place to come if you're looking to have a drink and catch up with a friend. They offer food, none of which I've yet had the opportunity to try. However, they have Blue Moon on tap so they automatically win my heart in that respect. Nice place to lounge while having a drink. May visit again someday.

vwAqPgyeWQI6v_wmjRdfyw.text: So yummy !   I had the lovely experience to try this place before heading to the airport ! my good friend lives out in vegas and she took me here . the food was so good from the risotto balls to the cheese plater and grilled cheese ! also how can i forget the sangria and bloody Mary ! honestly one of the best bloody Marys I have ever had !

G9RLzGhf7EJ7IzeIF11YwA.text: This place has a great vibe and fun atmosphere. The bartender Kyle was great and didn't look flustered once... but it was under staffed for the volume for happy hour. The owner - an older gentleman who wandered around the bar like a lost puppy never assisted the staff with anything. He stopped and talked to a few pretty girls while he ignored my credit card that was desperately sticking out of the check presenter for over a half an hour.  I will come back- just  not when it's busy.

3ZUisoptKaMFjRL-WzBXGg.text: A great place to relax and have fun. I come in here every so often with my coworkers to have a drink after a long shift. Amazing vibe, supreme drink selection, and excellent customer service. Vicki, my waitress was always attentive, kind and very funny. Will definitely be back many times to come.

UME0MZr8SDHo60NPqmQH8Q.text: Went in on a Saturday for brunch. Brooke was our server and she was super friendly and very attentive. They offer a bottomless brunch with endless options. The food was amazing. The patio was clean and comfortable. Will definitely be back again!

UMDHJAw9OFyfe68hn05eFQ.text: The charcuterie boards here are AMAZING. Not only is it a nice place to spend my days offthey are pet friendly on the patio too!

8DxiWd5AWxPHh8wG0nQcJA.text: We came here for Christmas Eve after our shopping it was pretty cool very empty the place is clean dark lighting. We got there right on time for happy hour. Which was cool. We started off with shots. The sangria didn't have too much flavour. But it was still pretty good. They didn't have many flavours of vodka. The staff had a very good attitude, but it did take a little time for them to give you attention. There is an outdoor sitting area with fireplaces that weren't turned on. We did try out some of the snacks and they were good. I didn't (check) or see if they had any gluten free options in the happy hour snacks so that's a little bit of a negative.  The margaritas were served in mason jars which was cute and they were tasty. Good place to sit around and chat with friends.

SkvdRFD8-P4vnYQqyGd8BA.text: I REALLY wanted to give this place 4 stars, but I cannot. My friend & I decided to use our weekly get-together to give Double Helix a try. From everything we looked up, it was right up our alley. Great menu, impressive wine & cocktail list, happy hour specials...in a sophisticated, comfortable atmosphere.  When we arrived, it was early evening well before a dinner rush & we were seated right away. The food was awesome, service was knowledgeable & friendly.   Here's the rub. It was a Sunday, once football kicked off the music went down & the TV sound went up full blast. We asked if the football commentary was going to but audible for the whole game, our server has to go ask & returned to tell us that yes, on "this night" the game would be on.   Here's my gripe. If we wanted to have a football game blasting over the speakers, we would have gone to a sports bar. Unfortunately, it prompted us to get our check & leave. We were really enjoying the food, drink & service but this is not what we signed up for. Maybe we'll try again, off season.

RcEoqYXDZj52RL2IXxP6Uw.text: Brooke was an exemplary waitress. It was my first time here and I was pleased by her suggestions. She upsold me on a lesser known whiskey, which was a delightful introduction to my palate. The food was amazing and delicious. I highly recommend the arancini! Brooke provided efficient and professional service that not only impressed my date but also surpassed my own expectations. I would recommend this place to all my family and friends with the hope that Brooke will be there to guide them through the delicious menu.

c3d-ZygcrKxmcDfhq1NkZg.text: I love this type of Bistro. But the waitress was clueless, an unattentive.. We went for Happy Hour Thursday, and the wine pour is like half of a normal pour, so you really aren't saving money. $6.00 a glass, so your getting probably 6 glasses out of one bottle equaling $36.00 so your making a killing.  My husband drinks IPA beer, and the happy hour IPA was out, so did they substitute?  No. We had to pay full price which was 21.00 for 3 small glasses.  That's not good service...My girlfriend ordered asaid I  well scotch and water, and they charged full price~~~and had to argue with the waitress over why isn't Happy Hour, she was oh we don't have Happy Hour price for Scotch ,What???   Really, let your customers no this.  Just crazy ... Your local customers  aren't coming back with that.  Lord Flemings gives a better pour. The charcuterie was very very thin sliced, and the cheese portion was smaller then what Delta serves on the plane. The atmosphere, the bar is really awesome.  You need to bump up your pours and your small bites, and your place could be the **locals go to bar***

WNnrM9mR9XGTPHwgFM1e9Q.text: This got to be probably one of my favorite places! Las Vegas, every time we come up we always stop by by Helix fire pit romantic as fuk!!!! Our service A+ by beautiful Kristen knows her wineswe love you from sunny California Bay Area!   Sal O

CsmU6-Qa6jN4YmyrCtKr_g.text: I planned a surprise party for my boyfriend at Double Helix and Michael was very helpful in the planning.   He was fair and offered great suggestions for  small plates to have ready for the group when we arrived.   We were planning on having the party around the firepit, but strong gusty winds forced us inside.  I was so worried there wouldnt be room for my group of 15 but Michael made it happen and reserved a large table for all of us.   His ability to accommodate a last minute change like that is an example of excellent customer service.    The food was great, the arincinis are my favorite.  The whiskey was even better and Michael even sent over a birthday drink for my boyfriend while we sang to him.   Jessica our waitress was attentive and offered suggestions for drinks when asked.   Would highly recommend this place for a small gathering or even just a date night - they really excel in customer service.

hlEokQyjKjXdpcPu1j53Iw.text: Great happy hour! This is pretty much the only time I come here just because I love their happy hour deals. They have great wines available during this time and great food!  The only food we ordered this time was the fried oreos since we had just eaten dinner. I would recommend these if you are looking for a dessert. I mean it's fried and it's a cookie-how can you go wrong?  I have ordered pretty much everything from their happy hour food menu in the past and you can't really go wrong. My favorite is probably the Arancini out of everything. If you are looking to only get one thing I would recommend that.   They indoor and outdoor seating. During the winter you can sit by a fire pit which I haven't tried yet but is on my to do list!

5SIyqQzFBNX-sWi2o8Oa-A.text: 5/5 compared to the other bars in Town Square. 3/5 if you aren't limited to drinking at bars in shopping centers. They have a nice outdoor patio with couches and a fire place. The indoor seating sucks so be sure to snag a seat outside! They have a pretty extensive wine/whiskey list and a short list of your usual cocktails.  Decent happy hour, menu with food- however more of a place to grab drinks than eat. It's located in the center of Town Square, in front of the movie theatre, next to Yard House, catty corner to Yogurtland. Parking behind the movie theatre gets you the closest :)

MMw2Y0pZPtnExSjl41cFnQ.text: This spot across Killer Shrimp is a delight.  This and KS are unlike the typical stereotype restaurants which surround them and are always my choice over the ones across the way.  Always consistently good service, great wine flights and small, yet filling appetizers.

sPRpT8hzzYL8QJEQYgcsHQ.text: Cute little spot inside Town Square, right across from Gameworks and the movie theater. This seems like a nice place to take a date, maybe order some wine and a cheese platter (which looks amazing). It's dimly lit, and has a kind of romantic vibe. A few friends and I met here for Sunday brunch and sat inside. They do have a patio, but it was as bit chilly to sit outside. I will be sitting out there when the weather gets warmer though.   So they have a small brunch menu, which has a few appetizers and a couple entrees. For an appetizer I went with the crispy olives stuffed with chorizo and honey goat cheese. Sounds delicious right? Well these things were TINY. I guess I expected a larger olive to hold all of the filling. I couldn't taste any chorizo and could faintly taste the goat cheese. I wouldn't order these again. For my meal I ordered the veggie omelet which was delicious! It had seasonal veg, although I don't remember what exactly, and fontina cheese, and it came with a side of potatoes. It wasn't too much food, but it was just enough. My friends ordered the steak and eggs which looked ridiculous juicy and delicious, I will definitely be getting that next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie omelet and potatoes

oH4hp1wh3DCphg4FVY9ZKg.text: While my group had decided on the Brio bar to have our meeting last night, it was packed so we moved over to the Double Helix at Town Square.  Their happy hour was in full swing and we all ordered from that at first.  After the first round three of us ordered from the salad section and we were each pleased with the plates.  They were good sized portions for the cost which was around $5 each.    The only hiccup of the evening was when the bill came and they had double or triple charged us for some items.  However they correct it quickly and apologized saying their system was having issues.  I would definitely come back again to enjoy the happy hour or try some of their wine flights.

LjU89CVkPAXBAu06VVqcVA.text: Great hang out bar, nice decor that's unique. There's an outdoor area that reserves fast, I suggest you reserve early. Various flight options available. Try the Mezcals and whisky. The presentation is nice and staff is friendly.

EkTW1_4pJnuaf7WCGKh7rw.text: Really enjoy this place. Perfect spot for dinner with friends, first dates or a casual place to grab a drink. The food is tasty and delicious with a wide variety of options. The bartenders are incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. For flights and tastings, it's hard to find a better bar. A great place for whisky. Also has one of the best happy hours around.. definitely recommend!

W5EkTh0OkkytqgMElnn38w.text: I hate to leave negative reviews, but this place was something else. For a GNO, We wanted to try someplace new. The menu was simple everything is reasonably priced; we could tell that their main focus was drinks and the food was a little more fancier than the usual bar food. We ordered the Long Island iced tea, Jameson Mule, Shortie tacos, and Fellini fries. We downed our first round of drinks and hoped our food wouldn't take too long...but 30-45 mins to almost an hour we waited for our food; It was shortly after that the manager came out to our table and apologized, offered to cover our second round of drinks (which we took advantage of). Our food came out, hoping it would be a decent size; the tacos came in 3 (finger food size) and the Fellini fries were better than the tacos ): Although our server was super nice and our water refills was on point; I'll give this place 2 stars. Maybe I'll change my whole view of this place, if I stop by in time for their bottomless brunch!

sl1bNriM3K9Q89uN_ecUBA.text: Been here many times over the last few years as town square locals. Jessica and Kyle (and his kilt!) are fantastic bartenders. Really really know their their stuff. Their whiskeys are great but we've also tried their wine flights and bottomless mimosas with brunch which are equally fantastic. Selection is vast. Service is superb.  Husband and I had our first date here back before it was double helix, so glad we can come back here and have a great time again. Low key, great ambiance, outside area with fire pit a plus. Never had a poor experience.

F4EX1e3PjLXcHSQ3NCKXzg.text: This place has a good happy hour and the food is really good.  Our server Susan was amazing, she worked her heart out keeping everyone happy and served.  On this visit they had $2 tacos but we decided to order items off the menu and everything was really good.  The little burgers were ok, the pesto was amazing on it and the fried cheese was good as well, the burgers were just ok.  We also had fried risotto balls and they were AMAZING.  The only complaint was the bartender.  I ordered a mojito and she forgot to put the grenadine in the drink.  First off, the bar was not that busy and if she would have focused on her job instead of wanting to chat with another lady sitting at the bar, maybe she would do her job better.  She seemed more interested in chatting and acting like a customer instead of a bartender.    What was even worse is that instead of telling me they forgot an ingredient, both the server and the bartender hoped I would not notice.  REALLY???  This girl needs a new career and anything with drinks is NOT it.  The second drink I ordered supposedly had all the ingredients, but it just did not taste the same.    I like this place however if I come in again and see this girl bartending, I will not order anything from the bar.  IF there is no way to get a drink without going through the bar, I will go somewhere else.  I don't care for dishonest people and this girl was trying to be dishonest instead of taking responsibility for her negligence.     Aside from the bartender everything else was good.

dJX95N0yQrf8v9iE5oGzsg.text: Nice place to stop in for happy hour if you are out at Town Square. The prices are very reasonable & the food was pretty good. They allow dogs on their patio which is a plus for me! However the patio is pretty jammed packed with furniture that's too big for the space so it could be rather uncomfortable if busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 eaten cheese plate. Only 7.99

SwngntGtl_36wNk_VEOgNg.text: Double Helix was great! Our server knew her whiskeys and wine! Thank you for a fun evening

zJqrkBvGUGr5Xb25_KWnWA.text: When your mom is in town and says she wants to have a few drinks and "eat light" there aren't very many places that come to mind. Double Helix is the kind of bar that a lot of other cities take for granted, and Las Vegas' equivalent is a PTs. It's a great place to go for an early evening cocktail and light dinner. Since it's in a shopping center it's also a great place for a light lunch on a shopping trip. The main downside to Double Helix is that it is in a shopping center so I hardly ever come here as a local (even if it is a "locals" shopping center).   DRINKS: My mom ordered the ABC wine flight and I ordered The Last Samurai cocktail. The Last Samurai was $16 which is pretty damn expensive. However, when I realized the cheapest Japanese whisky on the menu is $12, I figured fine I may as well have a cocktail. Can't be ordering a cheap Japanese whisky for fear of getting judged by the bartender. The bartender informed me that the cocktail is different now than the menu's description and he sort of alluded that it's a "dessert cocktail." That almost made me not order it but I did anyways. It wasn't overly sweet, sort of similar to a Manhattan. It actually reminded me of those chocolate oranges in foil that come in slices. I guess they got rid of the grapefruit part of it, which is what caught my eye in the first place. I would probably order this again if I knew I only wanted one drink all night.   FOOD: Since we went on a Thursday we got a free Arancini with the flight my mom ordered. The Arancini is basically 6 fried risotto balls. It tasted like truffle mac and cheese inside so.. very good and even better free. We also ordered the Shortie tacos and the Blazin' sliders to share. The Shortie tacos' short ribs were AMAZING. I want all my tacos to have this meat. My only complaint was the tacos ended up looking pretty empty, they could have put more filling in them for sure. The Blazin' sliders were surprisingly really spicy, but I like that. It's the perfect amount for two people. The fried yucca sticks were basically tortilla strips. I think they could have given us a little more of these too, or just left them off altogether.   If you can get here for Happy Hour, that's the way to go because the prices are borderline too high for what you get. Keep in mind you can order tacos for a few dollars cheaper and burgers for a few dollars more (with fries) next door at Yardhouse. I like Double Helix because it's an upscale bar with better-than-average bar food and it's not smoky and doesn't have video poker all over the bar. Sure, it's in a shopping center, but it allows you to escape Vegas for a bit and pretend you're in San Diego or somewhere chic-er than here. It's still a great option for first dates, girl's night pregames, happy hours, or light dinners with cocktails.

YmAvlGJN041Ra1rqtvBNzg.text: On June 24th 2019 I had the unfortunate pleasure af try to get a cocktail at this bar. I have been going off and on since opening for a drink and cigar. had just a nice dinner t Texas de Brazil and wanted a Gran Marnier I to;d the hostess I would sit at the bar but realized I was being ignored. I went outside since I thought I might also have a cigar. After beoing ignored by two waityress for about 15 min. I decided to leave. When I told the hostess her response was I thought you were sitting at the bar. I told her I was also ignored there so I moved outside where there were two waitresses. I asked if there was a manager there but no. I have recommended this place to may friends and guests in the MGM Grand where I work but never again. It is obvious that this bar does not care about customer service.

96FlAJO7NlMenKF3Hl-vMA.text: Just happened to pop in here and it was awesome. Not too many places can make a good old fashion. Definitely coming back.

-WOYAXF4I-q1o-FcQ9Y-0Q.text: Atmosphere was great,  wait staff polite,  nice place to sit and relax, eat some appetizers and have some drinks while walking the strip!

az-SVSpAv4HuU88nR8Hbcw.text: The tipsy pig is the ultimate whiskey drink. We frequent Double Helix and they never disappoint.

mcgch_2cfT1yKu9S7mGUHQ.text: Thank again Yelp for the help in finding this spot!   We were looking for a new bar to check out that had some apps we could enjoy. Yelped some places around me and Viola this came up. I had seen this spot before she at Town Square so we decide to check it out.   Upon entry the hostesses greeted us. We chose to sit at the bar. Our bartendar welcomed us and took our drink order.   They have a huge selection of whiskeys and wine from all over the world. It was great to have such a variety. They offered flights as well, Yay!!!! I started with a cucumber garden martini, very refreshing and light. Then moved on to the around world red wine flight. Loved the Bordeaux it was a blend so it was easy to drink.   They have happy hour everyday till 7:30. Longest happy hour I've seen, especially on a Friday and Saturday. The happy hour menue isn't very big but we opted to try a few of the items.   Arancini, vegan hummus and yellowfin tuna were my favorites.  We tried the olive poppers which were a bit odd, different however. The stuffed jalapeno was quite large and filling. Smoked Duck charcuterie wasn't our favorite, tasted a bit processed.   The ambiance is nice, they offer seating out on the patio around a fire pit which can be a fun place for a friendly gathering.

63L1wST_tGy2duad1G0E5A.text: solid selection of wine by the glass. good for a date night outing but i was solo so the romance  was lost on me. not cheap but not overpriced either. didn't try the food so can't comment. not too busy at 9pm on a Tuesday but the patio was pretty packed. inside bar fairly empty.

vGpQLfof8wrekppXiYBl6w.text: This place is horrible for dining in, my food was served cold. The bacon was burnt and potatoes were served cold, not worth the money and the average price is around $15, please do yourself a favor and go somewhere else if you are looking to eat a meal.

QJ5xxs9sbdVmSG67biCTfQ.text: Alright, kind of hammered as I write this review thanks to Double Helix.  Going to review on drink tips for now because that's all I had tonight.  Once again, just the tips.=)   This is my 1st review hammered, but regardless, I'm always honest af..so let's do this....  Service: Our server Kristin was so sweet..  She was totally cool with explaining the wine flights order a 2nd time as my buddy snapped it.  she just started watching game of thrones and we made sure we didn't mess up her show by talking about the recent seasn.  All I know is that Khaleesi's army is super extra....as was Kristin taking care of us.  Drinky Drinks I sampled tonight, was feeling whisky then moved to gin... 1) Last Samurai = Suntory Whisky Toki + amaro + scrappy's grapefruit bitters + topped with lemon juice  2) New York Sour = Wine-Spiked Whiskey Sour 3) Last Word = DH Barrel aged In + green chartreuse + maraschino liquor + fresh lime juice  The Last Samurai & NY Sour were tasty af and got me hammered quickly.  The Last mf Samurai was my favorite, by far.  I like their style.  For whatever reason, I switched to the Last Word with Gin for my last drink, word.  Little too sweet and overwhelming for me, kinda like my last couple of relationships but like this drink, got my last one in, said goodbye and we both moved on amicably.   Just let it go, so something new can enter your life..ijs..  Value: $16, $15, $11 were the prices of the 3 drinks I had.  Tasty and less than a bad lap dance/decision in vegas. So I've heard...  Ambiance: Intimate, couches and conversation.  This is where you can find all 3.  Chilling on the couch + booze = stimulates good conversation with good peeps.    Summary: Although blitzed, I know good service and drinks when I experience it.  Thanks to the staff for hosting a great night as we entertained our close friend from out of town. Double Helix's casting couch is a great place for conversation and to catch up for drinks.  Time to hit up some food and update this review in the near future. Respect...  .

0agcvFrsinECLZKRLdDqrg.text: I hate giving bad reviews but based on the simplistic nature of the issue. I felt neccessary to post this. Double Helix makes fabulous drinks, I won't say anything bad about that I love the various cocktails & whiskey but the service needs improvement.  It was not very busy, during happy hour we ordered we two drinks and two entrees, the waiter forgot to add one of the food items. If it was busy I can understand, it can get loud there can be room for misunderstanding but this waiter felt he was going through the motions. The tacos were good, but I felt they were soggy because they kept falling apart. Afterwards we chose to pay the bill and go to Yard House for burgers.

YD3Tu_ifAjG4CiHWFTZguA.text: Came here for HH for a friend's birthday- the focus is definitely on the wine and whiskey, and the food is secondary so plan on a meal ahead of time or opt for the cheese or charcuterie plates. Location is large but maintains an intimate atmosphere and service puts them a step above other options in the area.  We shared a bunch of appetizers but nothing stood out as especially good- the tacos got raves from some in our group while the arancini stood out to others, but the taquitos, fried olives, and stuffed pepper dishes were not something I'd order again.  Our group of 6 was welcomed by Michael, an owner or manager who is crazy-nuts about wine. He came over and let us sample one of his favorite pinot noirs, not yet available on the menu, and spoke with us extensively about it- his passion for wine was palpable, and is a large part of why I'll be recommending this spot to other winos.

tOr8kGO6EuGocEifwMAUMQ.text: A lovely couple Rach & Adrian, recommended Double Helix for happy hour and turned out to be a great decision for Lavi's birthday and new job!    Original plans completely changed last minute.  Even so, not knowing exactly how many attendees would show, we were able to get a table which accomodated our group - no reservation; and were seated almost immediately.  Great regards to our lovely couple friends (my new daughters - inside joke).  Indoor and outdoor seating is available.  There are bar height tables, regular tables, lounge couch seating, and bar seating.  The decor is super cute.  I love the lamps in this place.    The happy hour menu is really cool.  HH includes wines, whiskeys, and pretty good appetizer options.  The tacos get my vote!  The truffle risotto balls are good too.  I tried the whiskey mule... smackering sourness... get me a drool bib!  I'd say I'll just stick to an original or a raspberry ginger beer with J.D.    Leaving out the cons in this review, as overall the experience here was good.  And I'd return for happy hour hangouts with fun friends.  I'm not a smoker, but this is also a cigar bar.  Michael, the General Manager was extremely generous to acknowledge Lavi's birthday and introduced a new wine that just came out on their menu October 1st.  Much gratitude sir; you made her night extra special.    Also, the pinot noir that was introduced to us was definitely thumbs up.  I had only tasted a French wine at a thanksgiving dinner once; didn't capture me.  This Bourgogne, changed my thoughts.  It's really pleasant; not heavy - especially the after taste.  Wonderful introduction, thanks to you!  Cheers to many more new and all sorts of celebrations!

OW6RgMD5S85emJBmutH2GQ.text: Small happy hour menu but really good stuff.   The place is nice and clean, large, great for large and small parties. Our server was really sweet, attentive and friendly. Food came out very quick, and excellent service from all of the staff.   We pretty much ordered everything on the menu and liked all of them. Especially the tacos, meat was super tender and great flavors. The mushroom and truffle oil fritters were amazing! Had to order a second order. The tuna on taro chip was also really good! Their regular menu is not that expensive either. We ordered mushroom ravioli - the sauce was delicious!! The meatballs were also really good, meatballs were super soft and tons of flavors, garlic knots that came with it was fluffy and flavorful - dipped these in the ravioli sauce and OMG - heaven in my mouth!   Will definitely come back for happy hour! Wanted to try their beignets but was too stuff - so obviously I will have to come back for the beignets...and the fritters...and the tacos...and everything else!!

However, the outdoor seating has a fireplace and intimate/group seating.  Their happy hour was insane. Smoked Duck, gourmet braised tacos, cheese platters, drink specials, they have it ALL!

zWAXyOZIh1-kv5l7N-Mxkg.text: Finally got to try out their happy hour on a Wednesday night with some friends. I love that the wine of the month is half off on Wednesday's and their happy hour goes late until 7:30 pm.   The four of us shared the three meat & three cheese charcuterie board and I also had one of the bang bang jalapenos. I loved the bang bang, very different and not too overly spicy. For the cheeses I definitely recommend the goat cheese and Gouda. The prosciutto was my favorite of the meats.   Overall this place was pretty good, the service was a bit slow which was the only reason for a 4 rather than 5 star, but I'd come back again.

One impressive one was the cab rose from south africa! Service was vegas on point and super awesome. Keep it up guys!

0fESLD5JlU0ZqYNzFsJSKg.text: Wow!  Amazing wine and spirits.  Ambiance for every experience.  Indoor and out door excellent in every direction.   Tapas and fine dining meet in an embrace of elegance.  It's where romance meets envy and desire is inspired.  It's where the columation of imagination meets the intrigue of anticipation.  It's where the taste of tantalization is fulfilled.  I guess I could say they just do it right!   Bravo! Double Helix!

RnI_8RpgbXfRXDnIp4weCQ.text: I go here every year for my birthday as a treat since after happy hour it is a little pricey. We often go after wine walks as well. This weekend I was very upset when they told me I couldn't make a reservation and arrived with my large group to find there was no space because they had other reservations. I was ready to leave and never ever return despite this being one of my favorite bars. The manager however realized what a mistake they had made and managed to remedy the situation and was very accommodating. We will return for sure!

Os9piO09T4er69FlbBbQpQ.text: Love this place . So good for date night and just a little relaxation and cocktail . Ps try their food it was delicious

guTclx0KxokHCO3da79GgQ.text: My favorite place to get drinks at Town Square. Its hip and relaxed at same point. Their finger food goes well with their drinks. Try out their old fashioned, its pretty great for whisky lovers.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Bull Vodka

OEKDjd-b0fEdooKSz_dFtg.text: This place is good and bad. They have a decently priced wine list, and it is in a good location, right by the movie theater.  They also have a patio, which seems like the best place to sit and sip on a glass of vino.  I stopped in here randomly because I've been meaning to check it out for awhile.  The bartender was friendly....maybe a little TOO friendly, if that is possible.  I don't like people I don't know (who are providing me with service) to address me by "baby" and things like that.  She was just kind of weird.  The food looked pretty wine bar standard....flat breads, charcuteries, cheeses, etc.  I didn't eat, but it looked good.  I had 2 glasses of red wine, and when I received my check, it was a bit more than I was expecting.  The bartender explained that the price I was expecting was for 1/2 glasses and I was getting full glasses (I didn't realize this was an option, and would have MUCH rather had the 1/2 glass).  It was, of course, on the menu, so it was my mistake.  However, it would have been nice if she would have clarifyed this with me when I ordered.  She was more interested in other patrons, who she apparently knew and were ordering shots.  Also, they didn't have a closing time listed on the door, and there was a pretty good sized crowd in the place....but they just decided to close at Midnight.  Suddenly they were telling everyone it was last call.  Again, weird.  One really great thing:  they have Templeton Rye on their menu.  This is a small rye from Iowa, and I've never seen it here in Vegas.  I didn't order it, but it is nice to know where I can get it!

zLJYzo6uYcXGCP-wJDqWug.text: An extensive menu of whiskeys! Should get more stars...but the service and atmosphere wasn't exactly what I expected.   The staff running this joint seems like they just stepped out of high school. Gossiping at the register, cliques at the hotess stand. Getting off work and hanging at the bar in your work clothes...  Upon entering the lounge, it smelled like a bathroom. I could've left at that point, but we decided to stay & give it a chance.   We were sipping our drinks inside at the bar, and the music started playing "N'Sync"...then a song by "New Kids on The Block" and I said aloud, "what's up with the boyband music?" One woman at the bar said it was from an app on your smartphone where you can control the music. I asked her if the customers are controlling it? Because for a wine & whiskey lounge, it doesn't seem like a fitting dynamic. She semi-explained that you get to pick one song for free then you have to pay for the service. The next song that came on was Brittney spears. We paid quickly and were ready to leave.   The bartender came running out with a big smile and explained that one of their coworkers was controlling the music from home as a joke. It's not funny when it's running business out of your front door.   Here's an idea; don't play child's music at a wine and whiskey lounge. Try that. Then maybe everyone won't be standing around and gossiping because you'll actually have some business.

u-MhnkcbfaGjnPuhyDUsjw.text: If you're looking for a place to take a cheap or blind date, this isn't the place for you, unless you're both whiskey people. It's a bit hoity-toity, but for the type of establishment they are, for the huge selection of whiskey's they carry, it's expected. Huge variety of whiskey---not sure about other liquor since I only drink whiskey. The food is delicious. Some of the food is quite small with regards to portion size, but it's amazing. Love the appetizer tacos and blazin' sliders. The deep fried olives were nothing special and could have done without.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the sign for the restrooms. If you&#39;re &#34;pissed&#34; for whatever reason, this sign will surely make you chuckle!

41zzLa4NrYQBTflVQNFuxg.text: I went here for Happy hour and the appetizer prices were  pretty good. the food was very tasty and the portion sizes were pretty decent. I got here at 5pm and we were the only people in the restaurant bad thing: this place was totally empty- It was not until 730 pm that 5 tables were full. service: They were all friendly but a bit slackers.  Atmosphere: Elegant, nice decoration modern restaurant

UF_sxNwOgALfZtM8EUTfcA.text: Great place to hang out with friends and drink. Snack foods are good and their happy hour is amazing! Half price wine on Mondays.

xt6pe4xeSzwaiM8gNeiOmA.text: Overall amazing!!! Brought a friend here who is a diehard whiskey lover for his birthday. He absolutely loved it! Great selection of whiskey, cocktails and pages of wine. I did not try the food but what was being brought out looked delicious! The cigar menu is pretty big as well. I had a makers mark 650 with a makers mark old fashioned and it was the best combo of my life. The outside patio is perfect for people watching or just to chill and talk with people or friends. They have a large fire pit that will keep you warm on those chilly evenings. The staff is very nice and super knowledgeable on everything. Huge kudos to them!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign out front

7SmCYBePIOG_g9lhgLlFow.text: A few friends of mine came here for a change and loved our experience.  From the bartender to the cocktail server and right down to the food and drinks.  Everything was just perfect.  I am a big fan of this place just because it's cozy and comfortable.  The noise level isn't drastic and annoying.  We can actually talk to the people around us.    The bartender who served us was very knowledgeable with what we should eat and just brought out drinks that she thought we would like based on how we described our personalities.  The food she suggested since we weren't all that hungry was:  ARTISANAL CHEESE SELECTIONS accompanied by seasonal fruits + homemade onion jam + quince paste + gourmet bread BOUCHERON goat milk . ivory colored paste surrounded by a bloomy white rind . creamy gooey middle + claylike toward the rind  5 CHEDDAR two-year aged handcrafted with premium cow milk from small Vermont family farms + creamy mouth feel + unforgettable individuality  5 MOODY BLEU made in small batches from fresh local Wisconsin milk . delicately smoked over fruit wood to create subtle smoky undertones with hints of roasted nuts + coffee . rich + sultry + seductive  5 COMTE AOC fruity + nutty French gruyere . from the Jura Mountains in Switzerland 6 TRUFFLE BRUSCHETTO cow + sheep milk blend for extra flavor + dimension . folded with pieces of black + white truffle . sweet + tender + plenty of earthy truffle flavor 8  CHARCUTERIE SELECTIONS accompanied by mustard + homemade pickles + artisanal bread SPANISH CHORIZO  spicy + dry with touch of smokiness from Spanish smoked pimento 4 SALAMI TOSCANO  black pepper + touch of salt + fresh garlic + fennel 4 PROSCIUTTO  cured on the bone + aged over nine months . sliced paper thin 5 SMOKED DUCK  enjoy the layer of crudo + fat + skin on this naturally smoked Magret 5 SPICY SOPPRESSATA  rich flavors of garlic + peppercorn + paprika + fennel + red wine 6   This was awesome and definitely worth having.  Most of our drinks were beer and wine.  However, there were a few shots our bartender made us to keep the night going.  I just don't remember what they were.  I just remember how much fun we had here that night, thanks to the company we had, the bartender and the food and drinks.

nR9Gq0OXUfOPgIwwSt5ivQ.text: We came here after the Town Square shopping crawl. Double Helix serves tapas so we decided to order the Blazin Sliders ($9.00). They were made with Angus beef , bacon, avocado relish, and chipotle aloi. When they came out they looked unreal. Some places serve you sliders all smooshed and sloppy but the tops of the buns were fully rounded.  They tasted really good too! We also ordered the Pearfect Salad ($9.00). It had spinach leaves, grilled Asian pears, bufala mozzarella, candied walnuts, rocket arugula and spritzed with champagne vanilla vinaigrette. The pears were good sized and four of them came with the salad. It was delicious and big enough to share.   I love the food here but the drinks are overly too strong for me. Mu husband ordered a grown up shake but I could only take a sip from it.

zyrwo2LIhqqz8Ei4JF2j6A.text: We were there early, around 4 pm.  Kyle our bartender was great!! Very attentive and made the best drinks.  I had Gin n cucumber lime, and my hubby had Jameson cask.  My drink was delicious!!!

RfUFlAYe7Mrz6mSww47ynA.text: I really liked this "Ultra Chic" spot they call Double Helix. I ordered a Cheddar Cheese Board with a glass of Moscato, my sister ordered a Lucky Ray and my best friend ordered a Cucumber Martini...needless to say It was FaBuLoUs night. We spent such a great time here with our fancy drinks and our fancy conversations.   This Is a great place for groups where you can sit in front of a fire pit on the outside patio or you can stay nice and toasty Inside In a corner where It's more Intimate for those one-on-one date nights. They also have a daily Happy Hour from 3-6pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BCSDCPc5m7i9AYihVQnvOQ.text: We went to Double Helix the 1st time back in Dec 2013 as a stop on our "progressive " dinner. Yes I know normally people go house to house but in Vegas (and NYC) we go bar to restaurant to bar.  It was a great choice for the 1st stop. We had a round of cocktails. then ordered the Chef's Selection of Charcuterie & cheese plus 2 orders of sliders along with a carafe of Sangria. More than enough for 6 people.   Or so we thought.   The Chef's selection was perfect for a little nosh - but we are BIG folks & so we ordered a second one of the top 3 choices from both cheese & meats.   The smoked duck & the chorizo were the star attractions from the meat side while the Moody Bleu & the truffle bruschetto were the big cheese.   I want the homemade onion jam on everything.   The "boys" of the group wanted cigars - so while they were having around of maker's mark cigars, we ordered another carafe of the sangria. I'm a sangria purest. fruit, juice & wine. But why stick to boring fruit when you can have blackberry brandy, orange vodka & apple schnapps coupled with a very full bodied red wine.  Luckily there was some nice crusty bread to soak up all the liquor.   But if you follow my yelp, you'll know i'm in this for the 'fatability"  So yes they have nice hip friendly seating. without having to ask for it.   Food: tasty & fresh Ambiance:  pleasant but a bit loud with the tv's going.  Service: attentive but not overly so.   total bill was $176.00 including tip & cigars. Appx 60.00 per couple. Not bad.   Would we go again? Yes! Tonight as a matter of fact. What better spot to celebrate National Crap Spackle day?

ytMeseGXypV1t8r0HNP18A.text: The atmosphere was dark and woodsy, just what I want from a whiskey bar.  The service was fantastic and our bar tender was very personable and friendly.  He gave us tasters of different scotches and had some great taste on things to try.  I had the Glenmorangie 12 yr Nectar and it was awesome! My wife had the Yamazakie whiskey and that was equally smooth and delicious!  For a night cap appetizer, we had Truffle cheese platter and it was fantastic!  I highly recommend you try Helix out!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Cheese Platter.  Delicious!

6dt0HqAeiatl-lqxVDOeXg.text: Definitely a terrible brunch place. Their champagne drinks for brunch are bottled sugar liqueurs and champagne. So gross! The beer is even warm but I guess that explains the empty restaurant.

yYDcIA0L5hV_D4I0HFq7Zw.text: I've been to Double Helix in Town Square quite a few times and have to say that customer service, atmosphere, and F&B are always great.  Try the Brillat-Savarin with the suggested pairing, of course, and also check out the Olive Poppers, Arancini or anything else on the happy hour menu.  I think I've tried everything else here, and you rally can't go wrong.  An excellent after work hangout and being in Town Square, you're close to a few other places to hop to afterwards.

d3aAAJGlAi2uge4-huKHLA.text: I love Double Helix for their excellent staff and great variety of wines and whiskeys.  I wrote a recent review criticizing their issue with their air-conditioning situation, but I'm happy to report that they have rectified the situation and it's now cool and enjoyable once again!  Thanks to Michael, the GM, for reaching out and taking the steps to fix the situation.  Once again, Double Helix is at the top of my list!  Great brunch, too!!  Thank You!!

d7743Wl91uoqWeQkiPiLpg.text: Wonderful place. Great service, especially at the bar. Food is very diverse and well prepared.  Not sure why they play 90's alt rock in a wine bar though.

7yMrPctMv8t7LLk5PmyaQw.text: Double Helix @ Town   Square is one of my favorite happy hour spots.  Their hh is a generous 3:30 - 7:30 daily with half off house wines and selected appetizers.  Their house wines are pretty decent.  I can't visit without ordering their Southern Shrimp & Grits or the Truffle Bruschetto cheese, (which is cow + sheep milk blend for extra flavor + dimension . folded with pieces of black + white truffle . sweet + tender + plenty of earthy truffle flavor) paired with one of their tasty charcuterie choices.  Great menu &  service.  Reasonable prices with fantastic location.

Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grown-up&#39;s Grilled Cheese - gruyere &amp; smoked ham

9vLM_g4cA_tmv8kx4TB5gQ.text: We popped in here for Girls' Night on a Friday night because we heard about $5.00 wine tasting and various food specials. Yay! A new place, new tastes, and deals to boot. How can you go wrong?  Let's start with that part, shall we?  The service was mediocre at first, and that's being a bit generous. It was about 15 minutes before HH/tasting specials were to start and the place was not busy by any stretch. Three or four servers and two bartenders seems like plenty of staff to get this party started with some recommendations and indivualized attention and service.  Um... *flags someone down, gets acknowledged, waits a bit longer*  Let's try that again. "wave/flag/air horn*  Hmmm...  "Oh! Hi, didn't see you (after making eye contact a few times)."   *sigh*  Once we began ordering it wasn't that bad. It's still a cumulative experience, however, and it was a tad slow throughout the night.  The other WTF moment came when the specials were explained. Two specific dishes and only the house wine were offered as specials. The server even admitted that the tasting was almost always the house wine. So it's not a tasting, but a special on house wine. Got it.  We ordered a couple glasses of wine to taste something new (and help us decide on a bottle) and then ordered a bottle of the collective favorite. The wine selection isn't bad. I found some new things to consider and some solid restaurant favorites. Still, for a place that is part wine bar, I have seen better lists in lesser places. Just a thought.   We also decided on food and ordered the steak (one of the specials) and a charcuterie plate.  *This* is where it all picks up. The steak was generously portioned for a tapas/appetizer selection, had a fantastic flavor, and was perfectly tender. The charcuterie plate was fantastic. I wish there were more (quantity of each versus quantity of choice - there were lots of different flavors already represented) cheese to go with the copious amounts of meat. That is my only hangup, however, as everything was paired creatively and the small additions (gelees, fruits, nuts, etc.) were unquestionably complementary... and seasonal to boot, always a plus!  We also shared a death-by-chocolate sampler that, aside from being a diabetic coma on a beautiful plate, was done well. Various takes on sweetness, richness, and textures made it all work together and offered something for every type of sweet tooth.  Service improved a bit, as I said, as the night went on... but it was still a little too inattentive (including forgotten water, twice).  Parts of the evening were 4-4.5 stars, some were 2. Overall, a solid 3-star (maybe even 3.5), A-OK kind of place that, even if just for the charcuterie, is most likely worth a return visit.

Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese/charcuterie special

1iBQX0kloBmjdxaBy2GoyQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place, and was pleasantly surprised to find they have a spot in Town Square.  They offer specials during their brunch on Saturday & Sunday from 11 AM - 3 PM.  The arancini were so good we ordered them again!  LIttle balls of risotto, marscapone, and mushrooms served with a white truffle aioli...mmmmm....  We also tried the bbq pork sliders, very good as well, American fries, and the heirloom tomato salad.  The salad was another hit!  Fresh burrata, arugala pesto and a sweet, rich balsamic.  Very refreshing.  The fries were a really nice surprise!  They are served in a cone and seasoned with shallots and herbs, and then served with two sauces:  a sherry aioli & a spice ketchup.  Yowza!  And the drinks, you might ask?  That's why I've been wanting to try this place.  I started with a pear winetini, a refreshing, slightly sweet (not cloying sweet) mix of prosecco, pear vodka, and st. germaine.  I also tried a flight of red wines from Italy - very nice assortment.  They have Happy Hour specials as well, so I'm thinking there's more arancini & wine in my future.

lWplL4ndO-rggAS5Z68cSA.text: Our go to place in town square where you can expect attentive and quality service, excellent drinks, great food and a great atmosphere. Jessica is one of the best female bartenders in town and both she and Kyle are excellent at their craft.   Go for the Arancini all the way btw.

1Gw1TgMpjWARwqefkG9B9w.text: If you enjoy whiskey or bourbon,  you're gonna love this place. Excellent service and a superb happy hour with tasty specials make this a no brainer.  Be sure to get a Manhattan with extra cherries.  Outstanding.

OMFm4zRrP7RdFEgmfLzBag.text: Double Helix is definitely one of my favorite places to go in Town Square. My drinks of choice are wine and whiskey so it's the perfect place for me. It's also conveniently located half a mile from where I work so I frequently stop by for an after work drink and on occasion some food as well. They've changed the food menu a little but from what I've tried so far the food is pretty good. I recommend the adult grilled cheese, it's mouth watering. I bring friends in often and always sit at the bar. Kyle and Jessica are great bartenders and they make the experience all the better. If you're in the area or taking a shopping trip to Town Square, I definitely recommend stopping in Double Helix.

5P6njsyDgkBFmlxAjuvq9Q.text: My favorite go to spot.  When the question is "where should we go" the answer is "Double Helix"

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Well it&#39;s a picture of a taco... So do I need to describe it further?
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vesper

9ZucPzClW0eqCrx7J36Heg.text: This is one of my favorite happy hour spots. Their sangria is AMAZING. The atmosphere is very nice and makes it a fun place to hang out. The food is also pretty good. All in all I would definitely recommend Double Helix to anyone looking for good food and sangria!

O-flFI8LTQCcup8XArTATA.text: Really cool bar and they always write funny things on their chalkboard outside. They have a variety of whiskeys and cocktails. My favorite bartender is Kyle! He makes the BEST martinis. I never order off the menu when he works, I just tell him what kind of drink I want and he comes up with something for me. The only food I've ever had here was the meat and cheese plate, which was excellent. This is a great place to have a couple of drinks with friends and the location is excellent since it's on Town Square.

Ii6pqdtJGb00h8QP-n-HgA.text: Quality off the Strip wine bar at off the Strip prices.  WIN!  Straight to the libations.  There is a short list of outstanding, highly rated, old world and cult wines offered by the bottle at dirt cheap prices (ie the impossible to get '09 Mollydooker Velvet Glove $225.  It's so hard to get that a wine shop in Hawaii only let me touch and caress the bottle but not buy)  There is also a good selection of wines by the glass offered both in full and half pours to help with tasting.  Unfortunately whiskey, scotch and bourbon drinkers are left out.  For a place named Wine and WHISKEY, you expect more than just the most common names behind the bar  The simple food is wine centric.  It all pairs well.  Props to the "Grown-ups grilled cheese" with its gooey, melted gruyere and smoked ham core; olive poppers (goat cheese and chorizo studded olives); and the rich mushroom arancini with a white truffle scented aioli.  The cheese and charcuterie selection is very good (thanks to a misunderstanding, I tried them all.  No one thought it was funny to serve a dish for 5-7 to ONE me huh?)  They do offer salads, sandwiches and pastas for those wanting something heavier.  Don't be surprised to find the same items at their other location, Bottles and Burgers.  Great happy hour from 3:30-7:30  Recommended

Z6IFFTc5cTK_5D-jZ9olZA.text: Located in Town Square on Las Vegas Blvd. Just south of the Las Vegas Strip. They have a great selection of Scotch and other liquors, an incredibly friendly and attentive staff. Although I did not eat when I was there, the food looked very good and the people around me eating had nothing but praise, since they looked like people of discerning taste I will go with their opinion. I should also mention they have an extensive happy hour menu. Stop in and have a touch of the creature. Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

vRys54nyQcxMT_VMv4LdcA.text: My friends invited me for happy hour and I had tuna, spicy slider and their whiskey choice for happy hour. I can't say much because I'm neutral about everything.  It wasn't horrible but it wasn't anything to rave about.  The noise level was too much which made it hard to socialize.  The server was nice but inconsistent.  At first she smothered us and at the end trying to find her was a task. I don't think I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna on happy hour menu

ehYUTd-s6o1_pENCqSW8NA.text: I too experienced high school type service last night while with my friends.  Sat down and waited literally 20 minutes and nobody ever greeted us or took our order.  Music was playing dumb boy band crap for us too.  For being an upscale wine and whiskey joint, you would expect higher class service, which is what I'm accustomed to.  We got up and left, and the dumb hostess said thanks for dining with us...I was like wtf?  I decided to let out my frustrations here, because obviously people need to know what type of immaturity runs this place.

Bvjxkib3LsdCmabCkTH1qQ.text: Stopped in for some wine and a bite here the other day.  Great wine selections from the boutique across the hall,had amazing tempranillo.  Service was good, so why only two stars?  Ordered  the bacon appetizer, delicious!, some cheese - good, but nothing special.  Also, two of us ordered burgers - pointed out we both asked for blue cheese and they had cheddar.  Bartender said they would remake the burgers, which we said was fine as we were not in a rush.  Five minutes later, what are clearly the same burgers reappear with most of cheddar scraped off,   Same French fries, now cold - mentioned to our server who wasn't particularly interested but did get us fresh fries.  The burgers (one medium and one md rare) were delicious, the new French fries were also amazing.  Really though? A $20 hamburger and the kitchen makes it wrong and scrapes off the cheese?  Wouldn't you at least comp the food when we are drinking wine at $150?  Our server did say he would discount the wine, not sure if that actually happened or not...

uCXWVDMRx130TM60IkSKZQ.text: The place is great for happy hour but can get pricey if you go after that. Typically cocktails are around $11-15. My favorite thing they have is the whiskey flights. They range from $23-60ish. We were seated by the hostess on the back couch and she was very accommodating. We had people trickle in and out which I know can be a nuisance but there were very nice about it. Lisa was our server and took excellent care of us! We had the "grown up grilled cheese" which was excellent. They're plate sizes are similar to tapas. Very small portions but cuts up so everybody can have a tiny piece. Overall great experience!!

spsExTp15IQy84_y7_hH5Q.text: Half price select bottles of wine on Mondays with yummy, reasonably priced charcuterie to  compliment each other. it's really chill, nice outside seating. Great place for when you want to feel fancy without paying fancy. Enjoy! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. smoked duck and Brie cheese plate simply amazing .. must do the half price bottles on Mondays

lPxubDzGWLdG_sN-jmAyKw.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for a place to go for happy hour. We were excited to see a place to drink next to a movie theatre.  We were very disappointed with the service. Our waitress was rude, she didn't ask for our I.D.'s, she demanded to see them in a suspicious tone. We also got there before happy hour ended and we as soon as it was 'over' the deal no longer worked.  We would maybe go again, but we would be sure not to order the adult grilled cheese, it was very mushy.

0XPet3IKKeAXkJL-9l690g.text: I came for happy hour and only had drinks. I SO need to come here for the food, it sounds delicious. Ordered the Stone Sour and it was so good. I really have been enjoying bourbon and I like my drinks more on the sour side rather than sweet. This drink was delicious, perfect combination for me. The staff is quite friendly and extremely helpful.  Happy hour is daily from 3:30 -6:30, and I will be going back for that. Which will turn into dinner cuz grown up grilled cheese sounds like it's got my name all over it!

y_XVZOKDvxf_eUJLAR413w.text: I go to Double Helix at least twice a week because I work for town square.  Was there with a group of friends and were joking around telling the waitress that we liked the copper mugs and asking if we could take one.  We ended up asking her to inquire with her manager if they could sell us a couple of them.  Ray the owner showed up and kept looking at our table, he was very creepy, before we left I let him know we were leaving because he was creeping us all out and he didn't care and just said "ok". I bring a lot business to double Helix the only reason I'm going back is because the staff is always awesome, to bad the owner is not pleasant to be around.

g-ssObyYL__SJSRCV_eDmw.text: A little on the pricey this place is still excellent. Great choice of liquor and wines and of course cocktails. They also have an excellent choice of appetizers. Highly recommend the hummus made in house. The sangria martini is my absolutely favorite for a sweet savory drink that always hits the mark. The venue is a little dark and loud but has a typical bar vibe. Great location in the heart of town square!

jXalV_Dbl5c7lUKuWNhYRg.text: Very laid back environment.  Amazing happy hour and brunch.  Very nice server. Affordable.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ABC. Anything but Chardonnay flight.  Terra D&#39;Oro Pinto Grigio, CA. Novas Sauvignon Blanc, CHL. Monchhof Riesling, DEU

KPbo930zOV2CHbi17TUF4g.text: WILL NEVER COME BACK! TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! Vicki the waitress asked me why (I DIDN'T LEAVE HER A TIP ON MY CARD)  I stopped by with a group of colleagues  for some drinks after a long day at work, and everything was going great until we were all about to leave.  That's when Vicki the waitress comes over looks at me and loudly says in front of everyone "Are you ok? I just wanted to make sure my service was good enough for you, because YOU DIDN'T LEAVE ME A TIP" I was baffled that she had said that I didn't know what to say, how dare she ask me why I didn't leave her a tip on my debit card? I told her "yes, I am ok you are ok" she then walked away and hid away at one end of the restaurant.  This upset our group as not one of us could believe she had just said that, how embarrassing and rude of her.  One of my coworkers gets up and speaks to Kyle one of the bar tenders and begins to explain to him what had just occurred.  And from the other end of the restaurant Vicki screams to us "THAT'S HOW I PAY MY BILLS" once again we were baffled with the way she was acting.  I stepped over to Kyle and explained how regardless of Vicki's day she had no right to treat me or anyone  in such a rude outrageous way.   I had planned on leaving her a cash tip, that of which she never received, nor deserved.  I can't even begin to explain how upset I was, this sort of behavior is TERMS FOR TERMINATION.  Kyle passed us his business card and apologized and we left, Vicki was nowhere to be seen.   I will never return here, which is upsetting because I love town square's, atmosphere.  Vicki was not attentive to our table at all, and provided terrible customer service from the very beginning, so she had never genuinely deserved a tip.  It's so unfortunate that we had this experience, i hope no one ever has to experience anything like this.

R_39S9rwyXxntvnA7OIVpw.text: We've been trying different places at town square besides our old faithful Claim jumper. And noticed that double helix does a happy hour 7 days of week with a brunch on saturday and sundays!  This is where we found ourselves for happy hour on a sunday at 3:30pm! Great selections of wines, and great food!  We ordered different cheeses and meats, and got a great recommendation from the server on the best cheeses and meats too.  Their grown up grilled cheese, and meatballs were also both yummy!  It's smaller than other bars in town square, but it's perfect. Lots of couches, large tables for big groups and outdoor seating too.  We haven't tried the brunch and unlimited mimosas/bloody marys yet, but will be back soon!!

qcKqgSbR9b_tH6cxbmyHpw.text: Everyone is so nice there. My boyfriend and I go there to enjoy great cocktails and enjoy each other's company. The owner and the bartenders are super friendly and knowledgeable. Black Manhattan, Dark n Stormy, and Mad Men are our favourites

4XtM3317wPUMINfELo-GtQ.text: The place seems to be run down a bit. The outside patio with misters is pretty decent but too many table it's all cramped up. Plus it's a cigar friendly outside patio, that was kind of a turn off for me. Whiskey triple tasting and food was god.

ze16P2n3uFzOkUxZa9qgPg.text: This place was great. Mainly because their happy hour made it cheap enough. Their food, while very tasty was wildly over priced. Like $4 for a mini-taco Their whiskey drinks were very good and at $5 drink happy hour was a good deal. I got to go watch my super hero movie with a nice buzz!!

3zXtqJ2T6CjbWcPPXH5ODA.text: Wow !!! The outside fire pit with comfy seating is amazing. There is plenty of open seating for a party of any size. If you have a party of 4 or more on a Friday night, I suggest calling ahead.   When you walk in, you are greeted by a host and asked where you would like to sit. They have two sitting options, outside or inside.  Happy hour is everyday 3:30 pm to 7:30pm with half priced select wines, whiskey and food. They have an amazing cigar selection with 12 different cigars.  They have a ton of different food options that range from tacos, cheeseburgers, meatballs, tuna, grilled cheese and more. They have a ton of wine, and whiskey options as well as mixed drinks and beer. I love how they offer local Vegas beers as well as bottled and domestic.  They also offer free WiFi and exclusive offers on their mobile app. If you bring your ticket from the movie you get half off any Double Helix Brand Wine.

7p0PhKt032uQXPdJgIiTJw.text: It's close and right off of the highway, but just far enough for the strip to not be a hassle to get to.  The food is good enough, but the drinks are absolutely phenomenal!! I definitely recommend this place for first dates.  If it's going great there is always more to do. If it's going bad get shareable and go, lol.  They also have excellent brunch menu on Sundays.

eRN3d776BUELjLDVBdMq2g.text: Great spot for a spontaneous date night or GNO.   Cheese and charcuterie  DOUBLE TRIPLE Five Year Aged Gouda - Gouda is always a good idea! Truffle Boschetto - TRUFFLE is ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS a good idea! My favorite of all time! Manchego - this was perfect as well. The pairing with the charcuterie was chose was amazing!    Prosciutto - the safe choice but always satisfying. Smoked Duck - MY FAVE! Paired with the Truffle Boschetto was the BEST EVER! Traditional Porchetta - this was delicious too!   Along with these selections came with various sides like their house focaccia bread, onion jam, honey jam, pickled onions, mustard seed, and apples.  Paired with a Double Helix Chardonnay for me and and a Stella for the hubs!  We left satisfied and will be returning again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fave! $31.59 to feed 2-4 people. Choose 3 cheese and 3 charcuterie.

PK4i7V2QdkJAOYutC0Bweg.text: Our server last night was great ! She was quick & checked on us often. She had good recommendations when we asked. Our young busser (coincidently from the Garden Isle) was friendly and on point clearing things out.  I enjoyed sitting out by the fire. The happy hour was long (3:30-7:30!) & I definitely was there til it ended. I enjoyed multiple servings of the half off whiskey of the month (it was cask strength too).  It was very busy and lots of people but the service was 100%.

uaTf1lw4wDQyQDx_wmLnKg.text: Went in at 7:15pm so it was still happy hour woohoo!! Had whiskey mules which were great , cucumber martini: good.  A few appetizers bang bang, seared yellowfin tuna:very good and taquitos: i could have don't without.  I would come back relax and have a cigar.    Restrooms were clean and decent.  A gender neutral restroom.    Marcus our waiter was cool.

Iquj3-IEz92YCj1HZW7b6Q.text: This is one of my favorite spots to enjoy a good bourbon and actually get to try new ones. They offer a "whiskey" of the month for 1/2 off. This month is the Redemption Rye. This gives you the oppurtunity to taste for a fraction of the price $$ and we all love that. The selection of whiskey is one of the best I've found and If you are a wine lover the selection is just as amazing.  If you are looking for a bite to eat they offer something for everyone.

fEGZQTu0Ucy7jmnqoSkR0g.text: Only came here for drinks and sat at the bar but wow the Customer Service is just great here.  Very friendly bartenders and staff. I had to bug a few while they were sitting at a table rolling silverware and they were so nice and sweet and didn't treat me like a bother at all.   The drinks are on point and delicious. The bartenders are very knowledgeable about all their inventory and different drinks. One of them happened to be walking by when I asked a friend a question about why they would have something as an ingredient and they stopped and explained why and we had a great discussion about It.  The only minus is the decor. It is a bit dated, or maybe it's just me. I don't care for red and black. Also the music was ai little different. Not exactly what I would expect to find at a 'wine and whiskey bar. Air supply was playing when we walked in and while there we heard Smashing Pumpkins, Creedence Clearwater Revival, Dave Matthews Band, Journey, and The Postal Service.   I love it but it's not exactly what I expected.  Overall we had a fantastic time and I will definitely be back

OoDtt99aMcsQ-dtx2EwTVw.text: Pretty solid happy hour. Nice waitstaff. Phenomenal whiskey selection as expected. I was super excited when I saw they had Pappy 23 year. I'll be back!!!

NCkNEGpNM9ysJo-qawiwpQ.text: Probably one of the best wine and whiskey bars in Vegas.  Tapas style foods are delicious.  The customer service is over the top friendly and professional.  Kyle is one hell of a knowledgeable and attentive bartender.

eXIijrUwiEY5EN0wLoi3-Q.text: Perfect date night spot.  Semi casual, dark, amazing happy hour specials, great music and great vibes.  As far as food goes, try their baked brie, short rib tacos,  and vegan hummus. Oh and be aware of their tuna jalapeno tapas, they don't mess around, it burns!

E764vVC9wkcc89sDHPe33A.text: I came here for happy hour with my coworkers last night. On Monday's they have 1/2 off bottles of wine until 7:30pm as well as $5-6 glasses of wine and discounted beer.   If you're interested in the $5-6 glasses of wine, many of them are already that price every day so don't feel like you're missing out and have to come during happy hour. There's TV screens so you can watch sports as well as a cigar shelf if you'd like to smoke.   I ordered the arancini (fine) while my coworker ordered the chapters salad (overloaded with shallots). I know it's a Tapas-type bar but I wish there was a portion of the menu with bigger entree-like items

G80g2CPFHShG0lQ-6YwpFg.text: Very trendy and popular restaurant and bar, stylish decoration inside, fast and friendly service, great place to hang out off the strip, less crowded.

cEvi7dnfI1RhAi6OiwbFTw.text: Awesome food & bartender Kyle, our fave!  Food is always fantastic & consistent so we ordered the BEST arancinis in Vegas.  I have had them at so many different places & in different ways such as, large like a meatball w/ additional ingredients.  Hands down, these are the best.    Excellent wine list, a unique, tasty HH & food menu.  Thank you Kyle for always being the bomb & we can't wait to come back for the rest of our faves here!  Mmm!!

h3wKRQioHRA12GJsSiymZQ.text: This has become one of my new must go places when I am in Vegas. I love that it is off the strip and away from the touristy places. I have been here a handful of times and each time had great service and an enjoyable experience. We always get there right when they open to take advantage of their great happy hour. I have made a charcuterie board where you can pick 3 cheeses and 3 meats from their lists. It also comes with bread and other various accoutrements including pickled veggies, mustard, jam, and fruit. We asked for extra bread at no charge when we needed more. They have a really great patio with a fire pit or you can opt to sit inside at the bar or a high or low table. I have never been disappointed with the wine selection and will most certainly be back next time I am in town.

CSQX6Bg3D0mjaih7yAM0cg.text: Love this place! I have been a few times now and it's always wonderful. I took a few friends and the service was great. The server was attentive and knowledgeable on the wines. We each had a wine flight and had a great evening. We will definitely be returning.

vayTVsq_qgeQAx42rIGdKA.text: Awesome happy hour! Makayla's the host was fucking amazing she set the mood . I enjoyed happy hour and enjoyed Marcus as well as Kyle !!!!!

S2J4cfD845WigLTaQFPOkA.text: This is literally one of my favorite spots in Vegas the staff here is good and they have half-price bottles on Mondays

zqJC-1Ah8_co3f6VOCkxkw.text: Came here with a GF for HH on a Friday night! Selection of wine on the HH menu was not bad at all and the price was decent. Clean place. Service was good! Wasn't so busy when we arrived but as we sat longer more and more people came. Overall a good wine bar to go to. Reminds of place Ive been to back home. Defintiely coming back here and trying their flight wines.

f38OyqMByyHIX2EifTcygQ.text: I'm giving two stars for our excellent server, excellent bartenders, and great food.    The experience was less than desirable.   I planned to have my 40th birthday dinner there.  I did not make the reservation (a friend made it for us), but I called on Friday to confirm.  The reservation was confirmed during that call.  When I arrived on Saturday, I was told that they did not have a reservation for us and was told they don't make reservations for Friday and Saturdays.  I was told that "when some tables leave, we will try to get you a table".  I promptly texted all the guests that were not there yet and told them not to come (as I was not sure those of us there would get a table).  It made me feel like a jackass.  We waited quite a while and finally got a table; in the meantime, a staff member spilt a drink on me.   They tried to make things right: birthday shot for me and a round of shots for the table.  However, when you planned to have a party of 18-20 for dinner and end up celebrating a milestone birthday with 7, it's a bummer.   The delay also made us late for the next part of the celebration.   It's likely a great place if it's not a special occasion and if your plans are loose.

LfwzaZ3KadA4it9lU5G_3w.text: Back again and it's always the best! Service was outstanding and a bottle of wine with great food makes s great night!!

pl0kA84cWz-MXHgUP1ClGA.text: Great happy hour and I liked the explanation of the whiskeys when I inquired. Like the cigar chooses and a nice outside place to smoke. It is very nice to have a small nice cigar menu when drinking good whiskey. This isn't allowed in Washington State because our wait staff is mostly ill people who will die prematurely of second hand smoke if they just smell it for one minute of their day, never mind the damn forest fires we smell for months at a time during the summers, anyway, sorry I got carried away......The menus items we requested were presented professionally very tasty. I'd tell you what we had but then you would realize just how much of this place we tried and that maybe overindulgent but ya know it was happy hour for like four hours!  We were very comfortable here and we had two wait staff help us since we moved to the smoking deck, both very professional and friendly.  I only give it a four because the smoking deck was to small.

6jhKWZTTl6Cv-GKBCMQ_NQ.text: Great for brunch! Surpassed my expectations. The mimosas are the best I've ever had. Multiples flavors and all great. The food was fantastic too - the chilaquiles and the Spanish omelet. You also get a free order of arancini with a bottomless mimosa purchase. AND we had a large group and they automatically split the checks. We were practically the only people in there at 11 at Sun. All drinks were reasonably priced.

-Wk9KL2OdCK_P-VeeMrRcw.text: This is my favorite whiskey bar. They have an huge collection of whiskeys for every taste and budget. If you don't like whiskey, they have many wines and other alcohol. The food is also excellent. I think the best part of this bar is the staff, in particular our bartender Kyle. He always remembers us, has great recommendations, and gives the same amazing service to every customer.   Check this place out for a great experience.

ovHmt-_1UFohcVsRBGkUNQ.text: Lushes unite!  I had a GREAT happy hour experience here with a girlfriend on a Friday afternoon.  I ordered the whiskey of the month, Collingwood, a maple wood Canadian whiskey.  I got to sample some first and it was exceptionally smooth with a minimal nose burning alcohol scent common to many whiskeys. I was a fan!   Foodwise, we ordered the chickpea hummus and the BBQ pork sliders.  The hummus was delicious and had a perfect consistency.  The BBQ pork sliders were so good!  The buns were soft but toasted on the inside.  The pork was moist, juicy, and very flavorful.  There was a wonderful apricot sauce and the chipotle slaw had a lovely tame flavor to it as well. All the flavors worked together really well. Both dishes were excellent for bar food.  The bar is sized well and the entire lounge had an adequate amount of tables and bar seats.  They also have a few large tables available to support bigger groups.  They also have outdoor seating available.  Double Helix offers a comfortably warm ambiance.  There are only two single stalls bathrooms though, so I found myself waiting for the restroom a couple times.  They use Rockbot, an app that lets patrons select music in the bar.  They had an awesome playlist that night with Florence, Imagine Dragons, and some of my other favs.  Our server was Kelly and she provided wonderful service.  Our water glasses were always full and we had drink orders in before our drinks were empty.   All in all, great happy hour and great price.  For 3 glasses of whiskey, 1 glass of pinot noir, and the BBQ pork sliders, I paid $32.  Not bad at all.  I'll definitely go back with some girlfriends or go here on date night.
