rPtTON4IHe5qbaJtn6fjgA.text: The place is amazing , i love to come here but this time the service super bad, the girl is rushing us to choose, and she dont know  nothing about the wines , im super dissapointment  about the service , but anyways the 2 starts are because the place.

Q0lAJdpxN_XZgJdYs4g5Ag.text: Ill just put it out there that I really hate having to go to Town Square for anything. When my friend suggested we meet at Double Helix because she loved their Happy Hour, I groaned a little but agreed.   When we first walked in the place was dead. Literally no one. We grabbed a table and ordered some Happy Hour drinks and food. The options are pretty good for both. The red sangria is great and you can get it in carafes. Also, the Happy Hour food was surprisingly filling and had some pretty swanky options. Those ahi taco things are killer.  After a while more and more people started showing up and by the time we left it was pretty crowded. Our server was really nice and always on top of refills and additional orders. Initially I thought Double Helix was going to be one of those Happy Hour places where you feel out of place if you dont have your nails painted and your best pearls on, but I was wrong. It turns out it is much more relaxed and enjoyable than it may look at first. The lighting is low and the vibe is just laid back.

wmFut_L7Sa9jMH4ATfndqw.text: My brother & I went here on a Saturday! Great atmosphere! Good food & drinks! It got busy towards the late night. A DJ set up half way through our meal & was playing good music. I love that happy hour is everyday (3:30-7:30). We ordered seared yellowfin tuna, shortie tacos, bbq pork sliders, mama's meatballs, grown up grilled cheese & the charcuterie & cheese plate. All delicious! Outside seating looked nice, so I'm definitely sitting there next time I go & I'll also be drinking more next time too.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie &amp; cheese plate with sangria.

HXypXvqxkfprVkHfzQyy2g.text: On a random night off, a friend of mine and I decided to head over to Town Square for a movie. Our plan was to hit up a Happy Hour scenario after the flick, and Double Helix wine bar fit the bill. I hadn't been in for over a year since it opened, and back when they were starting out it was kind of quiet. I was happy to see that business had picked up.   The bartender was really great, the happy hour specials were cool and the style of the place is nice. It's a bit mis-matchy in design, but that's for another review :) in any event I'm sure I'll be back down for a cocktail or two as they have a descent bourbon collection and I'm a fan of that. The food was just ok in my opinion, but that's relative I suppose. Basic and good for drinking, flat-breads and items of the sort. Check it out if you get a chance. Happy Eating!

cNDmRjVHv86Mz1f-sk4hog.text: Decent small plates restaurant in Town Square. Their menu has a few similar items as their sister restaurant Bottles & Burgers (minus the burgers). The arancini ($9,  risotto fritters with mascarpone, roasted mushroom, white truffle aioli) is just as good as the ones at Bottles & Burgers. It's also one of the best items to get at Double Helix.  The olive poppers ($6, crispy olives stuffed with chorizo and honey goat cheese) are good and not too salty. You get seven per order. The BBQ pork sliders ($9) have a slight amount of heat and are topped with a sweet apricot sauce and slaw with a marginal amount of mayo. The churrasco Argentino ($15, angus American skirt steak, chimichurri sauce) was tough  and chewy. Their "Perfect Salad" ($9, grilled Asian pears, bufala mozzarella, candied walnuts, rocket arugula,champagne vanilla vinaigrette) was anything but perfect. The best thing about it was the candied pecans. The fries ($6) weren't as good as the ones at Bottles & Burgers.  The atmosphere is relaxed and loungey, which is a nice change of pace from other spots at Town Square. There is a kid's menu. Our kid was with us and he got the chicken tenders ($5)... actually, that should be singular because it was only one chicken tender with a bunch of fries.

aq26PEtRZJc-26jBZja-gw.text: Was just there again for a little adult libation while my friends kids were wearing themselves out at Gameworks. Great patio. Just a little on the pricey side for a local spot.

JkVeEgmSkKZtBetlyKrGHw.text: Double Helix, Town Square - An elegant, comfortable, cozy place for happy hour (3:30-7:30, DAILY), either at its classy bar or in the attractive patio by the courtyard. It has an EXTENSIVE menu for drinks ($3-7 for beer, wine; 1/2 price cocktails, whiskey) and bar dishes ($3-6)! - See menu on this link: lvhhtime.com/double-heli... DETAILS: - There are several nice places in Town Square that I like to relax in over happy hour, and Double-Helix is among the top on my list, for its quiet ambience, great selection of drinks and bar food at very reasonable prices, as well as excellent, friendly service! It's the place of choice, when I prefer a quieter ambience; and/or when I'd like to try its whiskey special, also. Yes, they have flights of 4 different whisky combos on the menu. - Its horseshoe-shaped bar counter is small, but comfortable and inviting. Its beautiful display shelves showcase a great variety of whiskeys! From the bar, one can see the cozy, nicely furnished patio by the busy courtyard. The tiny dining area around the bar counter has an intimate ambience. Other than the courtyard, there is no view, however. MY HAPPY HOUR EXPERIENCE: - I enjoyed my happy hour here a couple of weeks ago. I had Stuffed Olives ($3); Arancini ($6), a Stella ($3.5); a glass of Sauvignon Blanc ($4). The olive dish came with six stuffed olives, which looked cute and were bursting with flavor! Arancini tasted a bit bland, but ok with djon muster dip. - A couple of gentlemen at the bar had a flight of 4 whiskey brands. I forgot the name of the flight, but remembered they said 3 of the four were absolutely superb! According to them our bartender, Jessica is an expert on whiskey. She was very friendly, efficient, and attentive to all customers. All serving staff was friendly, and helping each other out - good training and practice. - Wish it'd have reverse happy hour, too, for the after movie crowd! Peterskis, Nov 2012 --

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elegant Entrance and attractive patio by the courtyard

0syWIu6RAr6YMKZ4FLdj7A.text: I went to Double Helix with two friends for his birthday, and had one of the best experiences I could think of!  Way better than I expected.  We started the night with appetizers and wine in the restaurant part of the bar.  Our waitress was extremely friendly, polite, and knew what to recommend based on our tastes.  She even recommended the wines for us perfectly.  As we sat there talking, one of my friends had a question.  He waved down someone he thought was working there, and we come to find out that the person we waved down was the GM of the store.  It was nice to see the GM working just as hard as his employees.  We ended up having a nice conversation about the types of cigars, and he even helped make recommendations on what we should get for cigars.  Overall, our experience at the store was amazing.  The employees were helpful, the GM was amazing, and the food and cigars were perfect.

WuXDhQexRmKFcgTwrDGzSA.text: Been going here since it's opened almost once a month and typically go here to meet clients for happy hour.   Always seems like the same staff and two friendly bartenders which speaks volumes about the quality management.  Not only do they make amazing drinks but they're very knowledgeable about every bottle on the shelf.  My only complaint is that it is a little pricier than other bars e.g. McCallan 12 is about $18 when it's $12 next door.  The environment and welcoming staff make it worthwhile.  Take advantage of the whiskey of the month...  It's typically something unique for a great price.   **Update**I stand corrected...  It's $15 for the Mac 12 and apparently they pour 2 oz versus 1.5 so its actually cheaper.

JenIqOMsYwstrB1AQvT0ZA.text: Great little gastropub!! Tons of great whiskey. And drinks as well. Staff is always friendly and the atmosphere is simple yet awesome..They have a nice little selection, of cigars as well!

sWVKAWu_buxQOs-JsJv2wA.text: My favorite place to have drinks in all of Town Square. This warm & inviting place has ambiance, great appetizers and a phenomenal wine, estensive whiskey & cocktail menu. Friendly bar tenders, exceptional customer service & a nice outdoor patio with a center fire pit!!!

B7J4YAhzncDihlTMEjV0Pw.text: My friend and I hit this bar up while we waited for our wives to go shopping.  Since the place is literally in the mall area, it's no wonder the guys are here...  We liked our drinks (we both had the Bulleitproff cocktail at $14 a drink).  They were tasty.  The bartender was nice.  Ben did a fine job. It's just odd drinking there.  It just seems so out of place.  I'd go again if I had to wait for my wife again, but I don't know if I'd hunt it down.

fzhOaTsrxBiZAm6ICdv8Dg.text: I agree with Tom Davis' review.  I always really enjoy going to Double Helix.  Their whisky mules are a refreshing drink for the summer.  But God....the heat in there today.   Come on guys,   cool it off a tad.  I had one drink and left.  I love their staff and the food is great also, but not enough to stick around in the heat.

5XY9qDph-23skpo831TYqQ.text: Killer patio. Awesome selection of wine, whiskey, flights (even mezcal). Always crowded and a great intimate spot in Town Square, where there aren't many local/adult choices. Aren't many small, intimate cigar/wine bars for locals.   My only qualm is the service is always slow, and the prices are super high. $33 for the smallest cheese board and $17 for essentially carne asada fries be dumb as hell.

YBqUAUN3IW-1lUxtSJtcrg.text: I've been coming to Double Helix since they were at the Palazzo and have been a regular at the Town Square location since it opened. Their patio is great as the misters really help beat the summer heat. The manager Kyle is very knowledgeable about their liquor selection and is very knowledgeable about cocktails.   They also allow cigar smoking in the patio which is huge for me as I am a daily cigar smoker, and not many bars/lounges allow cigar smoking.

mLB_DlV9xssWBktkXlls6A.text: Went here for the first time, they get a star for decor, and decent happy hour prices for drinks only.  However, there is nothing happy about the food portions, which are ridiculously small. I had their pork carnitas tacos and still wondering where the habanero or the Helix sauce they shared in the description were incorporated.   Also, it seems they have one tiny fan for the entire bar so be prepared to be hot. I won't be heading back there any time during the summer, maybe in the winter and if I'm in the area. Definitely not a place I'd go out of my way for.  Last thing, they wouldn't do separate checks for our table, granted there were only 7 of us -  including two couples

HYtJCtKz9uqF1IFdasK43w.text: "It is being here now that is important," George Harrison. He also said:"there's no past nor any future!" One can take this way of thinking anyway you like, but too many of us linger in a small realm and cannot get out.   Break free of the realms that bind you, my visit is a venture to the  continues celebration of "the now." This was my husbands favorite bar, restaurant, and chill place. We spent so much time here! It's been over a year and I'm ready to "be here" again. It is a great honor to be able to explore and find happiness in the things that we enjoyed routinely again.   Moving forward, let's sit at the bar. It's warm and cozy on this bar stool that just hugs me. Marcus is my guide for the evening. Believe it with the weirdest weather happening around the globe. Is it not? It's snowing here. The snow was a sleet base; yes I said snow. The bar is the place to be; it's truly very comfortable and mellow in here. The bartender that continues to make my drinks should be referred to as the marvelous Marcus. I enjoyed his company all afternoon, into the evening. While watching him make drinks, his skills are that of a True master bartender.  As I sit here I relive ghosts of the past. A time when we would sit on the couch that's out on the patio. All gathered around the fire pit with a drink in one hand and cigar in the other. These are great haunting memories and images from so long ago. I am so glad that I can enjoy them now, even though my Chris only walks in the shadow. I came in on a Saturday and caught the brunch deal. This deal included either Sangria, Bloody Mary, Peach Champagne, and some other types of beers, unlimited for $20. This is an incredible deal. It's pays for itself after two drinks. I ended of drinking four before the deal ended. The drink deals that Helix has is outstanding. Continuing the celebration let's move on into evening with some Bourbon.  Presentation is Everything! Ordering my Bourbon on the rocks, actually rocked. The ice that the Bourbon was poured over contained a lotus flower. What a beautiful gesture? The lotus flower represents purity and perfection! The bourbon could not of been more perfect. Sticking with Bourbon let's see how good Marcus is at making a Whiskey Sour. Marcus made the Whiskey Sour to ultimate perfection. He even included the egg white. The Sangria that they serve here is only made with all the freshest ingredients and juices. Top shelf liquor is used, with a full bar. The spin on their Sangria includes slices of apple inside shaken and then shaken again: with apple cinnamon along the rim of the glass. My guide Marcus turned this experience into tolerable amazing fun with cinnamon on top!  Wow, this is work! Aside my Marcus, all of the associates that call Helix their home are a family. They move and treat one another with such love. They care for one another such as a family does. The wait staff could not of been more kind when we dined here with the twins either. Did I mention, it's doors are open to all. Although the littles cannot, "yet" be in the bar area; their day will come. Drinks are served all day and why not let the chefs here make dinner. Come, bring the children; save some wine. Create new family memories that the family will cherish for life. Let the family of Double Helix provide your family a fun and incredible dining experience.   Margarita pizza with cheese that will not quit. Ridiculously delicious. When they placed the pizza in front of us; first just blown away by the presentation. The pizza is served on a stone plate; thats not only beautiful, but keeps the pizza warm while you enjoy it. Lifting those slices up the cheese just lifts with it. In all its glory and there is so much cheese that it does not even pull away from the bread. The incredible smells coming from that pizza , just needing to taste it! My senses so wet finally I can enjoy; extraordinary. The sauce is perfect with absolutely no after taste. The fresh ingredients that are surrounded by massive amounts of cheese. Come explore your eye opening pizza experience for yourself. Let cheese rule the day, and it pairs well with your choice of wine. Salut!  Break the cycle! Know that happiness and life are a wonderful gift. Paired with fabulous drinks, sexy cocktails, cigars, pizza, and family and friends. Come trust the family of Helix to provide you and yours the very best experience and celebrations. Make new memories and live in the now! Cheers to humankind!

Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whiskey Sour!

UGazD0ZDM-kLuV8sIyNcXQ.text: Double Helix is the way to go for happy hour. Amazing Kentucky mules!  Atmosphere is incredible.. Low light, fire pits, romantic, you name it. Definitely a place to take a date... Or just chill with friends.  Food is great, but more for eating appetizers. Try the cheese platter... A little on the pricey side, however you get top quality cheese to pair with your fine glass of wine.   I'm the center of town square you can't miss it..  I recommend hitting the yard house for food, then coming here before 7 for happy hour 7 days a week.... Then of course a great movie after..

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice cold tall glass of tasty water!
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar tender
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio

ewYhpiW2XfDYR3UAlf8KBA.text: Went here for a girls night a couple weeks ago and the space is cozy - they have an outdoor fireplace with space for one group, which I hope I can sit in someday! I like that it opens out directly onto Town Square, providing a great view from most of the tables and bar. Tastefully dim mood lighting makes for a great relaxing late-night stop. Service was great.  However, the prices were a bit steep - $10 for two tiny bite-size lobster tacos? They were delicious but not -that- delicious. Cucumber martini was crisp and refreshing though, I'd get that again. I don't drink whiskey so I can't speak on their selections but as a bar overall, it was a pleasant experience.

OrE5uld3IWtzkrSv_g-VhQ.text: Pros: decently extensive wine and whiskey list. Very nice patio. Cool inside bar.   Cons: Its a tapas joint with very small portions. So you get the privilege of paying $14 for two sliders.   Also, in this politically correct age, gender neutral bathrooms are obviously a prerequisite for any bar that prides itself. They have a gender neutral bathroom, good for them. It's one of two bathrooms and the other is women only. As a male I can't help but roll my eyes. How "progressive". Imagine the indignant outrage if it was the other way around. I won't be come here again.

BXNd8c60hSAqW1BwrNcJiA.text: This is a nice place with good ambiance.  The tuna was delicious.   Great wine and whiskey selection. Thank you again to Makayla for getting my reservation in!

MQ6hYS2Qt2CuN2KcYYadtA.text: Looking for a great little bar to enjoy a drink and some snacks in Town Square?  Want somewhere near the cinema to chill while you wait or somewhere to enjoy a good value Happy Hour?  Well you found it!  Friendly and accommodating staff were there to greet us when we first walked in and there's a usually a good amount of seating, whether at the bar, a corner table or outside next to the firepit - they have a spot for you!  Double Helix offers a fun atmosphere to enjoy time with a partner or friends while feeling that you're being acknowledged and valued as a guest. A well stocked bar makes finding the perfect drink for you really easy and if you have ticket stubs from the cinema like we did, then DH offers their own-name wines for half off, even outside of Happy Hour! Amazing!  We had some taquitos while we were there and they came out hot and quite fast. As bar snacks go, these were great! Not greasy and full of flavour. Would order these again.  If this isn't for you, don't fret! They have specials everyday, a Happy Hour and a comprehensive menu, not lacking in ideas!  Double Helix is definitely somewhere I'd return to. For the variety of drinks, fun chilled atmosphere, friendly staff and tasty nibbles at good prices, it's a no brainer!

628n697Kg5GrJDDiWiU6nw.text: As far as "whiskey bar" goes, this place is 5+ stars. Incredible whiskey collection that includes some rare whiskeys from all over the world.  I didn't even know that whiskey was made in Taiwan! Mind blowing.  Knowledgeable bartenders - whiskey sommeliers, whatever the case may be, they know their stuff and can make excellent recommendations based on your preferences.   We didn't try the food other than charcuterie which was "eh." We will definitely be back.

aUf444ilNzf9SSEz8WDMGA.text: Great food, reasonable prices, especially Happy Hour and a dog-friendly cigar patio. What more could you ask for?  I tried the Shortie Tacos, which were simply excellent. The meat is "Blue Moon Beer Braised Short Ribs". It was tender and juicy, perfectly cooked medium rare. It was served with pico and a poblano sauce that was delicious and tasted homemade.  I also had the Spicy Vegan Hummus. It was served with warm pita wedges, toasted lavash and an eggplant topping. Overall a very good dish.  They feature a decent cigar selection. The cigars are kind of pricey, but you can bring your own.   I enjoyed the experience a lot and will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome cigar patio!

JcsTo4Rvp87mgKeLuX_rBA.text: The food was fair. The hummus that we ordered was delicious and tasted homemade. The ahi tuna portion was too small. It was Moderately to high-priced. The service was not good on the evening that we went. Cozy atmosphere. The whiskey special was nice.

orhxYylvdREdn5ZAej4now.text: I have been here several times and I always enjoy myself. The place is on the smaller side but Some key things for me are the decor is fun, the music is varied, the lighting is perfect for a date night. I love the vibe here and the warm feeling the place has. The mad men is probably my favorite drink I've had so far. I have never gorged on food here simply snacks such as meatballs but all were tasty. Wouldn't think of this place for a main meal but definitely great for light fare and some yummy craft cocktails. The staff is always super nice which always adds a star for me. :)

I_6M9asJzEfXlHrBhTYZfQ.text: I like this place, I really do but I must admit I've only drank here.  I've never ate here because it is too pricey.  I want to come here for drinks more because it is a really nice environment and the bartender is great.  He listens and is very helpful in deciding what to drink since they have a very extensive drink menu, which is always a good thing.  The problem though again is the price.  I get that the whiskeys are unique but I think they are easily overcharging.    That being said, I still come here, albeit less than I would like to.  I guess this makes it my guilty pleasure spot.  It's not something I necessarily need or can afford on a regular basis but yet I come here because the way I feel when inside.  I feel welcomed and not as nervous as I would say, in another bar if I happened to be drinking alone.

v_OiRnM5ttEwWbgcP1yBog.text: Thank you for a fantastic night! Sadie.not sure I am spelling her name right. But she made my night the best night ever. I had friends from out of town and we had happy hour. She ensured that we had a table I was comfortable with. We also had good food at a great price and the drinks were just as yummy!!!!! My friends visiting from the U.K. had a fantastic night. So 5 stars to this place. I will be back for sure!!!!!!!

De3W4btEpGFln1ckR2WH3Q.text: Happy hour is great! Good beer specials and some nice options on small plates.  The two played I had were delicious, mini arrincini  and the fried olives, both with their respective sauces.  Service was good as well.  Reasonable.

gkUnnVzc4eNyNoRfoPNpuA.text: Great food, unique drinks and a dynamic social scene. Great for date nights, w/ low light makes it a romantic setting! Double Helix has a full bar serving 60 wines by the glass, 220 whiskey labels, custom cocktails, wine and whiskey flights, as well as an assortment of small plates. The beer selection lacks, but there are options available. Double Helix offers happy hour from 3:30 to 7:30 p.m. nightly and an award-winning brunch, featuring bottomless mimosas, from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. The DH sangria is bomb.com, sugar cinnamon rim and fresh cut fruit!!!!

fkY9gS4L5fWvjzPEmWKZcw.text: I adored this place. We tried most of the tapas and my favorites were the chile relleno, seared tuna bites, and aranchilla. All the tapas were flavorful and delicious. They also had great happy hour on vinos.

QVjsJDmvL2nxTG5HECZxzg.text: Private label Whistle Pig Bourbon for $12 and if that's not enough there's great atmosphere and service. The outdoor space is great for smokers. You can bring your own cigars. My go to place for cigars and whiskey in Vegas.

nOPPVhs4qAQSvYYrjVhyhA.text: Great place for a drink or three with a terrific bourbon list at reasonable prices.  We did not eat here so I cannot rate the food, but the bar and the service - awesome!  Our guy Kyle was well versed in bourbon.  There was even a great bourbon special happening with a barrel selection Whistle Pig from the bar at just $8 a glass.  Yes please!  If you want the high end bourbons, they have those here too (pappy, BTAC, Parker's Heritage to name a few).  We finished the 2016 Birthday Bourbon and left with the bottle... because we can.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A few of the boys...

GLseCDaH5QM20Z9e4HN8vg.text: People watchers unite!   Great patio seating! Half off bottles of wine on Mondays!   We shared a bottle of wine and a cheese and charcuterie plate. Delicious brie, crusty seasoned bread and a sweet fig spread. Our server was helpful with other wine suggestions when the one I had requested was sold out.   A great place to wind down after some shopping or to have a romantic date!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie and cheese plate for 2-3 people.

_d2cSfvkBDUz1eb5LsD2yA.text: A place we enjoy because of the ambiance!! The music is upbeat, the drink menu is unsurpassable, decor calm and inviting and most importantly, the service and friendliness is exceptional!!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love the decor and ambiance of this place!! Jessica rocks too!!

FGo0gVFr4FGwQ1NirMP5fQ.text: Great wine flights great nibbles and the outdoor cigar lounge is great even for non smokers.   Just remember if you get a taxi I. arrange one out.  A little scary at night waiting  for ride.  Sketchy people ask to drive you back to our hotel.   Don't do it. Next time we will look around more

0lpwhiZKGyZkU0XCU-TmuA.text: I love this place! Either for a romantic laid back. It still kind of fancy dinner or for a nice brunch.  The menu is different for brunch and dinner.... at night they have really good cheese plates and sliders but during breakfast my go to meal is the steak and eggs! It is seasoned so good and comes with some fruit to garnish the plate. They offer bottomless mimosa on Saturday and Sunday and have like 20 different flavors. Yes flavors of mimosa. And you can get bloody Mary's too! They have a nice comfy patio which I super cool but they do allow smoking as this is a cigar bar so if you have a small child sit inside because smokers will be out there (had this issue before).  They do have a good happy hour and usually not too busy if a place so you can get a table easily and the servers are super nice too!

LJmwujaiUy3enUmHQ7zDDQ.text: I came here last month and several times before that. The ambience is perfect for a whine and whiskey bar (my 2 favorite things in the entire world). The have a beautiful outside fire pit/lounge area, a couch area, a bar, and tables for tapas. I love this place and cannot wait to go back when I move to Vegas. Definitely a destination spot!

6JPOBMBrFUpYbOOAybl9jA.text: I like this place but my visit last night was very subpar. We've all had a bad experiences so no sense in rehashing it. Improvement is needed by management in handling these situations as they seemed disinterested. Poor service in the hospitality industry is a result of poor training by management that doesn't care.

sDkPO7Hy-18QsePFp2GuoA.text: Stopped in for an impromptu happy hour with some coworkers and Kyle was our bartender. He was awesome! Very nice and attentive, but not overbearing. Introduced himself, learned all our names, and provided overall fantastic service. Made great wine recommendations as well. I've loved Double Helix for years, and this was another great experience! The only reason that I didn't rate it 5 stars is that I feel like the prices are a bit steep, especially since the happy hour menu is somewhat limited.

46hGETHE-Sj7iH7zSkFRSw.text: Nice place in a good location.  Nice wine and whiskey menu.  Ordered some small bites with cocktails....nice ceviche and shallow fried olives.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wide selection of fine wines and spirits.

oIqhF9StohY4_CaBdKoWVA.text: This is my favorite brunch place !! Everything on the brunch menu is amazing. We request Deborah as our server, she's so sweet && such a good server. They have many flavors of mimosas which we all love. I recommend the peach, the blueberry, and the bartender speciality which is a mix of blood orange and pomegranate. We come for the $20 bottomless all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pomegranate, peach, blood orange pomegranate mimosas

ey4h3F2CnwvujAHPilcREA.text: This is the second time I've been to this place, and it's still a great spot. The service and knowledge from our server was great, and the food was amazing. If you plan on hitting a great happy hour, or just want to go to a lounge to catch up with friends and family this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Triple- Cheese and charcuterie plates  Dubliner, Truffle Boschetto, Five year aged Gouda  Spicy Sopressata, Salami, Prochetta
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy Reds- Wine Flight $20 Tempranillo, Red Blend, Shiraz

jC3SoZKOIk1TnnH4kzIDHA.text: We went for the first time on a Saturday at 330.  (happy hour is daily from 330 to 730) We sat outside and their patio is absolutely gorgeous and super comfy.  The server was so attentive and extremely kind.  The drinks were amazing.  I had sangria, my spouse had an apple fizz (jack daniels apple and champagne I believe).  We had happy hour apps (bang bang which is a fried jalepeno stuffed w/ lobster and covered in a cream sauce) and fried risotto balls with a creamy cheese sauce (arancino).  They were both to die for, and super cheap, along w/ the drink specials, going on during happy hour.  Seems like a really solid establishment.  We will definitely be going back.

ta1q37BfISNslOlejPztcQ.text: We love this place, Jess is always so welcoming and knows what I want before I know. I love love love this place. Come one and come all... just don't take my seat.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate martini time

llPFNGhvTG790kBR4wrVBw.text: Kyle and Humberto were brilliant! Superlative service. Kyle recommended a sensational NEW English peated single malt whisky. On point. Thanks, DH!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PPXFurCOgof8VWT3ImS6uA.text: Love this place for happy hour!!! Rissoto balls are incredible! And also the wine list works well! Cigar list could be better, but then again it's all preference so no need to worry about them because they have amazing cigars, but service is superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2YLfvSwIk1nbdEyHzUCoGA.text: I sat on the patio and decided to try a cigar for the first time. Brooke was my server she was very helpful and knowledgeable about pairing a cigar with a glass of wine. I loved it!

BrSraOzMH2DdCZzhsGBpmg.text: Went here with my husband on a couples day and we absolutely loved it, asked the waitress for a sweet red and her very first recommendation was amazing I think it might be my new favorite. Had some Gouda paired and it came with marmalade a that matched perfect. Extremely impressed.

yWhh6nYJ7_tRWe939Y-vGA.text: Great spot for wine, whiskey, and charcuterie. You can pretty much stay away from the rest of the new menu, unimpressive. Wasn't too stoked about kids running around and two crying newborns in the corner.

Ja8AGy3SfE8OHClmR1agCA.text: If you are looking for a place to grab a quick drink, I don't suggest coming here. My girlfriends and I came just after happy hour and had to wait for a table, not because they were all sat, but because they were understaffed. In a situation like this, it's not the fault of the guest; perhaps a manager should step in and help run drinks or whatnot?   Due to the fact that they were understaffed, service was slow. When I am sitting with an empty glass of wine I shouldn't have to "beg" you to take my money. It kind of ruined the vibe of our night...do you stay and have another drink because the company is great or go find another bar? We  ultimately decided to have a second glass of wine.  The food was great and came out fast. We ordered the ever-so-popular Arancini and a cheese/charcuterie platter. The smoked duck was delicious and the cheese selection was nice. I would maybe suggest combining the cheese/charcuterie on one plate, or serving the cheese on a smaller plate as it not only made the dish appear smaller, but there was barely enough room for 3 of us to eat at our hightop. We each had a small share plate, glass of wine and glass of water...nothing too crazy.   When it came time to pay the bill the server, along with most of the guests, disappeared. Had it still been packed I would have been a little more understanding. It's almost common sense that after you drop off a check you should check back within a few minutes...  UPDATE: Tried this place again on a Thursday evening and took 10 minutes to be acknowledged/same slow service. They do have great happy hour deals so it's hard to resist coming every once in a while.

M-OmWn1QBv1dgPHPmUkOyQ.text: Happy hour! The best time to go.  Thee favorites! -Carafe of sangria (red) $13 great for one, two or three people depending on the mood.  Seriously, my favorite sangria in town.  Good times here :) - Arancini. Addicting. These yummy, little , crispy on the outside, warm and creamy on the inside and the truffle sauce is my favorite appetizer here.  Worth trying: - BBQ pork sliders - Blazin' sliders (not on happy hour menu)  Overall, great place for conversations, catching up, and relieving the day's stress.

N1pUEViaC8dDrz3ZyTVR3Q.text: We have visited this Double Helix location many times. This time the quality of the food was sub-par. We order the hummus for a happy hour snack. It was obviously prepared well in advance of our order as the hummus had somewhat dry "skin" to it and the carrots that came with it were slightly dry and rubbery.

8l0RfgMTNE0954miJi0zyQ.text: Came here with a group of friends for dinner and drinks. Small plates are great for sharing and everything we ordered was delicious. Staff was friendly and attentive and wine list was extensive with lots of affordable options. Definitely would recommend!

2ZSjSatcV0Pjo3dOqIAKbw.text: Great service from the moment my friends and I walked into the lounge.  The hostesses and waitresses were very attentive to service.  They recommended drinks, checked in with the table regularly, and made sure that we had a pleasant experience.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a nice wine and whiskey bar in Vegas!

hIKMSR4R9R282mKyuLxFkw.text: Awesome spot.  Went out to Vegas with a large group for a bachelor party and we found this off the strip gem.  We were all from the east coast, mostly new yorkers.  The food was off the charts.  We started with a few orders of apps and plates to share which were all delicious.  The place combined a southwest feel with some food that we could all relate to home - from mama's meatballs to the flat breads and everything in between.  The ambiance of the place was great - very mellow which was great for us to kick back and grab a meal, we were out there on a bachelor party and the place was great to just chill and enjoy some great food - not to mention the selection of booze is off the charts, which was good for our party and the place was crawling with tail.  Definitely a good experience and I would and will go back - as a tourist it was a great spot that was off the strip, away from the mayhem yet still in a classy good looking establishment that isn't going to pick your pockets.   five stars.

Zc0pNVN5TpUBekVfre2g1A.text: Used to come here for a happy hour  sangria a lot but then their sangria started not being so great :( I wish they go back to old way of making it as we are hesitant about coming again.

EJt78y6h8VOhd2m2FL-VTQ.text: Went here for a quick happy hour visit before dropping a friend off at the airport. The prices during happy hour and selection were great, I didn't try any of the food so can't comment on that yet. The bartender was very attentive and helpful. The happy hour sangria, although a smaller cup, was very strong and tasty. I'm glad another good wine bar opened up in place of the last one and I'm definitely going to visit again to try out some of their food.

ugVwcMpJl3AYwFQ9bUbr2w.text: Great happy hour very inexpensive. My favs, pulled pork sliders, street tacos, grown up grilled cheese. I would encourage anyone to try this place. Great wine and whiskey specials. Happy hour is 3:30 to 7:30 p.m., Monday through Friday. On Monday's after 9:00 p.m. they offer half of select bottles of wines.

PqfMtuWbEYUfn_gmLqN_fg.text: Great place to grab a drink before the movies. Staff is great as well!

wsX8pd8Luz78RUxiORKHkA.text: Great new addition to Town Square!  I love that you can get wine by the glass or 1/2 glass.  The prices were quite reasonable, the atmosphere was really nice and the bartender was helpful as well.  This place should do really well!

4_MUNUWrJIxMUtd6KUQ7_w.text: I like the new place. Great vibe, food and wine. See you there! I had the American Fries and Sliders and of course a Vodka Cran!

iQL1Rl1CZosiyKfm-QN6Mg.text: My sister was married on July 11th 2015 and we wanted a casual place to get food and drinks after the wedding and heard good things about this place. I asked if they could accommodate 20 to 30 people and seeing how the place was empty I didn't see why not. The hostess asked of we could sit outside which wasn't ideal since it was over 100 degrees and we were all dressed up. But we did anyways since we weren't given other options. At first We received great service and the drinks were great. Then as everyone came trickling in from the wedding our waitress seemed irritable. We ordered a round of drinks for everyone. 45 minutes later no drinks. So my sister (The Bride ) saw our drink order sitting at the bar getting warm so she kindly asked the waitress if she could grab the drinks for everyone. The Waitress then snapped at the Bride telling her " No you may not, clearly I'm the only waitress here so you can wait." needless to say many of our party left after the poor service and lack of their orders. Finally an hour later we got our bottled beers and mimosas. Paid and left. I will never be going back there again. Luckily a bar next to them had no issues taking our party and their business.

-FIhNfJsRRWS1ad4gaKbTA.text: Hosted a client happy hour last week on the patio.  cool spot, great happy hour.  We ordered a bunch of appetizers and most were outstanding.  GREAT selection of bourbons, whiskeys, etc.  I will be back.

6tW9o2myYnENWV2Gs0JI5g.text: Their website said "Lunch Specials Available from 12pm-3pm Thursday-Sunday!" And their hours of operations also said Monday - Wednesday: 3PM-12AM, Thursday-Sunday: 12PM-12AM. But when we got there at exactly 12 pm Thursday, it's closed! They should update their website as it is so misleading! bad business practice!

kQ_GGLGk5JAZeKF9o3bR-g.text: i think i would like this place better if they had a happy hour. it was a little pricey for 5:45/6pmish. especially next to yard house. the food was good, but small plate style. i came with a hungry male who just wanted to eat. i tried the cucumber martini that was recommended by our waitress and it was good. strong yet refreshing. we shared the pommes frites ($6 for a cone) and those were yummy. the blazin sliders were awesome. i love the guacamole on them and they had just the right amount of spice to them. 9 dollars for 2 though. the male friend was not pleased. the three little piggies were great. (10 dollars for 3) bacon wrapped dogs with a pastry puff? oh my. get in my mouth! (that's what she said.) but really. those were so good. our waitress hardly checked on us and when we had to flag her down we caught her staring off into space. poor girl must've been bored. it was over 40 dollars for all the goodies and my male friend still left hungry. so ladies if you come here with a guy make sure they understand small plates and sharing. for the prices of the small plates though i think i'd rather opt for firefly. it was okay, but not omg gimmie more! i may come back if i hear about a happy hour.

tUtBLjX7pUxNI-sG9jhJSg.text: The food was very good.  Very disappointed in the service though.  We had to ask for table settings, they brought us chipped plates??, no napkins??, then we asked for napkins, they gave us cocktail napkins?? like really!!!!  We went on a Sunday evening and it was very slow in there so we can't even say it's because they were busy!

X_P-BmrbO897qSAG3qNNHA.text: I found this place to be cute, trendy, and play good music; but beware of the absolutely apaling management! I was there having dinner and drinks with friends when an entire tray of sangria and other beverages was poured down my friends back as the server tripped. In good faith that this was an accident and the girl obviously was horrified and very apologetic, we did not cause a fuss and finished our drinks before leaving. However, when the bill came, nothing was done to compensate the ruined clothing or fact that he had been sitting there sticky and wet the entire time. When this was brought to management's attention, he came over and apologized and said that he had edited our bill to compensate, but when we were redilivered the check, it was HIGHER than when we gave it to him! One of the servers then told us that he didn't really care about things like this anyway. We left disgusted and will not be back. What a terrible way to treat your patrons. I hope other people avoid such an experience.

stw67AF-tsL7wK_Z-jO-_Q.text: My friends and I went to this wine bar expecting to find a nice selection of wine and a knowledgeable staff. Instead, we had a waitress that couldnt even tell us where the wine came from and had such a limited experience she couldn't  recommend a wine for us to drink. The flights they offered were boring and over priced. I will defiantly not be going back.

kQ-xnZpORsM6Y5EcmHlu8g.text: I'm giving this place four stars because of the slow service. Otherwise, great place! We went during happy hour which is 3:30-7:30. All four of us ending up spending $40 each, including tip. The decor is great and most of the drinks were great. The only complaint on the drinks is that I got the sangria martini and they put brown sugar on the rim of the glass. It is gross combined with the drink and honestly, I don't like brown sugar in the first place. Once I cleared away some brown sugar so I could drink, it was fine. The hummus was amazing and we couldn't get enough of it.. my friends got the sliders, grilled cheese and these cheese ball things. I tried the cheese ball things which were also amazing. They liked their food, as well. It was pretty slow to get anything out to us unless it was the hummus. The waitress also forgot a couple of drink orders so we waited forever for those and then we had to basically force her to take our payments. But the happy hour drinks and food combined with the prices are lovely.. I just wish the service was also because it would seriously be my new favorite place. I'll try again in a bit and see if anything changes!

yvs_D2i75ZdT3L2URbRrqQ.text: So, Double Helix has popped up at Town Square after the demise of The Grape.  We recently ended up here for a night cap after a night out.  Pros: the decor is nice and upscale.  They also have a decent selection of whiskey and scotch, and offer various cocktails made with whiskey and scotch.  There's also a nice outside patio area with fire pits, or something to that effect.  While some crazy bastards were sitting out there at night, it's just a mite too chilly for me at 40-45 degrees right now.  I imagine, however, that it will be pleasant to hang out at in the spring/beginning of summer.    Cons: it's expensive!  I can understand more expensive pricing for drinks containing premium whiskey or scotch.  But I ordered Irish coffee and it was $10.  Ten dollars for small cup of coffee with Bailey's in it? Give me a break!  There wasn't even a dollop of cream or anything fancy in it.  Adding insult to injury, once the bill came, I signed the receipt and placed it in the wallet in front of me on the table.  It's something I typically (and absentmindedly) do while my party and I wrap up and get ready to leave.  Well, our particular waitress came over, and without saying one peep, reached over me and my coffee, and grabbed the wallet.  (We were sitting at a bistro table and thus, were higher off the ground.)    I've NEVER, EVER have had anyone do that to me before at a restaurant or bar -- big, small, fancy or shady.  Who does that???  I understand that it was late, and they may have needed to close the register.  But, it would have been proper to ask first before physically reaching over me.  Nope, not here.  Not even an "excuse me" or anything.  Nor were we the only or last people inside; in fact, there was still a good amount of patrons inside and out.    I'm not a snob about service, nor do I have wildly unrealistic expectations.  I understand that people working in the service industry get busy, may be tired, have bad days, etc.  But this was simply discourteous and poor form.  Not cool, chick.         I like the place itself and *may* give it another try.  But sadly, it was disappointing the first go around.

b4LUdrW_2zR8HPizJuic-w.text: I went here the first time I went to town square and made sure to make it here for happy hour.  They had a lot of good deals, cheap whiskey, half price select appetizers, half price wine and cocktails on select items.  It was a good deal.  The food we got was good, we had the arrancini, the grown up grilled cheese, the steak with chimichurri sauce and a chopped salad.  The food was all pretty good.  I know my standards are high so I will give it a solid 4 stars.  The cocktails were good.  The only criticism is of the term "wine and whiskey lounge."  I'm not being mean but their wine menu was bad for a place that considers itself a "wine lounge" and their whiskey menu was boring for a place that considers itself a "whiskey lounge."  Don't go here expecting to be able to try some great wines or some artisinal whiskey.    If you are going to a movie and want a place to get a cocktail and a snack before, this is a great place.  Try the arrancini. :)

rSqDLk3JmEUr5_khtzTnUw.text: I didn't even get seated before I was greeted with rudeness tonight by the brunette hostess working on 6/11/15 nope not eating here!! IL go to yard house instesd

Nr-0zf_O-Wd4WZ6XqtTmEA.text: We've been here a couple times and every time we are there the owner Ray gives us a very weird vibe, he's rude and creepy. The staff is amazing though.

iMFL2O2FxwrkQzwXiSpkKg.text: Me and my husband love this place. Great drinks and food and the staff is awesome!!! Every chance we get we are here.

z7Y0JH1ck9w330YuLZykxA.text: This place had a great drink selection. The sangria was my absolute favorite with the cinnamon sugar rim! We sat outdoors and the seating was very comfortable and the fire pit was a definite plus. This is a fun place to meet for happy hour,  great for people watching at Town Square. We ordered a few items from the happy hour menu,  and they were very tastey but fairly small. Next time I will eat a little more before hand so I can enjoy all the sangria I want with one well paired appetizer.

suNJ1kdLdpKOFgVL0DQpXA.text: One of my clients is a wine tour that stops here & has been raving about Double Helix for months, so I had to stop in. This is definitely a great place to hang out! It's got a great patio area with awesome people watching being in the middle of town square. Apparently I missed the whole "Wine & Whiskey" part of the name, as I donned my high class Bud Light, but I'm sure their selection is great. Everyone I was with also loved their food. I'll definitely be going back, perhaps on a hot date! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dale Adams &amp; Kelly Rossi at the Double Helix at Town Square in Las Vegas

xc03VRY3ua1Zix2NmDFLVw.text: Things to get here: 2 bottles of Moscato:) with ... these are all Tapas: Lobster mushroom ravioli, shrimp buns, steak, pulled pork sliders and truffle fries.   If you are ever hanging out in town square this lounge is a nice place to kick back and unwind to some great tasting food paired with the best Chardonnays or wines. Helix has a full bar and there are big couches to relax & dine on too. Very chill. And the reason why I'm reviewing is because it's so far the best tapas I've tried yet. Enjoy!

GrO3DMeenpKMcdQWfn4e6Q.text: Double Helix and Town Square is one of those bars you end up at post 30 because you're post 30. I love beer. I mean I really love beer. however there's a grown ass man in me that appreciates a great single malt scotch and jazz music played right below conversation level. My cousin and I sat here at the bar and engaged in a rousing conversation about the nuances of strip clubs. It was truly profound.  We didn't eat but I I peeked at the menu and it looked interesting. Great place to "lose" the ladies and have some scotch and convo.

n7OTHuv0R-EI2_PpUSQJEg.text: Took my family from out of town here to try the whiskey flights.  In the end the manager tried to rip us off and our waitress, Brittany, was rude.  The prices were outrageous and the staff was not accommodating.  I was ashamed of bringing my family there.  I will not be recommending this place to any of my friends and family.  The manager, Michael, tried to sell us a 1 ounce shot of Jack Daniels Sinatra for $25.  The 2 ounce shot they sell is priced at $40.  The manager made up his own price of $25 for the 1 ounce shot which should have been no more than $20.  We were getting ready to spend over $200 but when the manager tried to over charge us $5 we made our way out.  When I confronted him about it he acted like he didn't care, was rude, and decided to change his mind  to $20 instead of $25.  I told him it was too late because my family was already upset and walking out the door.  He didn't even try to apologize and sarcastically told me to have a nice day.  These guys make over $500 off a $165 bottle (25 ounces) and you're telling me there was no way he could be generous or hospital to us for a 1ounce pour of fire water!?!?  We didn't want a discount, we just didn't want to get ripped off and pay more for less!   We had just finished dining at Ri Ra Irish Pub inside Mandalay Bay shops, and got a flight of single malt scotch for $18 and amazing service.  We even tried more whiskey after the manager came over and engaged in conversation with us and pointed out some single malts he wanted us to taste!  So we were stunned when Michael at Double Helix tried to rip us off right away.   If you want reasonably priced whiskey and hospitable service stay away from this place.  Worst experience I have EVER had in Las Vegas by far.  I have been living here for 8 years and used to work in the Food/Beverage Industry as a bartender/manager.  This is their mission statement online too: Double Helix strives to achieve and maintain such distinction in food and wine service and knowledge, delivered professionally in welcoming atmosphere, that the restaurant gains a first class reputation for unique gastronomy, gracious hospitality, comfort and beauty which draws new and repeat customers year after year.

hrikmdvDeZ6r15S5xWAcCg.text: Susan L was the sweetest and most absolute kindest and on point server I've had in a while. Her attention to detail was spot on.her attitude andrnr personality was very inviting and welcoming. We will definitely be requesting her again. If she were to leave this company we would be devastated. Such a great night thanks to her !

K-zZc1rJxJGf6Mu-0QKoFQ.text: I've been to both the Palazzo and Townsquare location, and I can say that I both like them equally.  The interior decoration for this location is very dark, but light and chill.  I like how the set up is made, and the mood of the music can be quite interesting if you come on a good day.  Sometimes it would be indie, other times it would be house. Regardless of that I did wish that the music was a little lower than it should be, I don't think we're at a night club guys.    Well onto other important factors, the people at the bar a nice.  Sometimes you might even have intriguing conversations with them.  I'd like to add that there is happy hour, but only on selected items and it varies on certain days.  The food here has been the number one attention grabber for me so far, I've tried almost everything on the menu and I can say I'm quite impressed for a bar that's well known for their wine.  For those who complain about the prices of the drinks, they're not selling the cheap stuff. You can't get a glass of merlot and expect it to be $2.00, you're not paying for a glass full of crap.  So excuse my language, but this isn't your typical bar where you just order cocktails and shots.  They do serve wine and the expensive stuff by the glass, hence the name "WINE and WHISKEY."  The food's served as tapas, somewhat like a Firefly experience.  What I did get to try were the: - Aracini: It was delicious and oozing hot fresh when I first bit into it.  The taste of the truffle oil was dominant, and I loved it.  - BBQ Pork sliders - I love the taste of coleslaw in any burger, and I was happy to have it incorporated.    - Quesidilla - MMmmmMM, what a well incorporated dish. Everything just oozed together, I was merely impressed. And the addition of guacamole just made my day.  - Heriloom Burrata - all I know that the prosciutto and cheese with basil leaf anything, is always good.   - Chipotle Slider - Guacamole in any slider with bacon in my book, is worth trying.    - French Fries - Ahh the crispiness of their fries, and the two sauces on the side.  I love fries, so you can never go wrong with that.      Aside from the food, I hope they do continue to improve with their kinks and do well because there food is amazingly delicious. That with a glass of Moscato, and I'm good. Tipsy even. ^_^

-9pDO6Qp6jeLEvXtJaXaIw.text: Really wanted to like this place. Town Square needed a whiskey bar. This place is prohibitively expensive, however. To add insult to injury, I was charged an extra $3 for rocks for my whiskey, making my single Johnnie Black $14. Completely ridiculous.  Note: This review was written when Double Helix opened in July, but just now published. I've avoided ordering whiskey or scotch since my initial visit, but sticking to happy hour, this place is alright. They make a decent Blood and Sand. The staff is friendly. The prices are just too high.

rNFz5H2Vg3CnFT3AxpiIMQ.text: I'm relatively new in Vegas and I've been searching for a bar to enjoy great whiskey in a relaxed setting. I found it as a Double Helix. The entire staff is amazing. Try to go while Dom is working. She's an amazing bartender with the best personality, always a fun time. They'll always have my business.

IQ2pF54MCtHbtBPUVzZE9g.text: OK - I'm home... this is the place where Sinatra meets Sting and the managing partner (Steffon) looks like Art Garfunkel. (are you old enough or old school enough to remember Art Garfunkel?) Never mind - GOOGLE him! Anyway, great selection of Whiskeys and wines - and a staff w/ a sultry attitude. Don't get me wrong - all about product knowledge, but good east coast street savvy. It's a fun place to meet people and still private enough to just enjoy those in your group. Visit anytime happy hour to late night and enjoy. Outdoor fire pit - great decor and a few pieces of art that get your attention? Class - old Vegas w/ a new twist. The NEW place opens next week (soft opening) Sumerlin - on the west side neat Rampart Casino. I'll review it and get back to you :-) I'd love to see a Peter Lik on the wall though (lik.com). What do you think?

MRcw90iX3lBshTbZNotyag.text: Amazing brunch menu, good service, bottomless mimosas ! Overall it's a great place. The price is very affordable too

hClXO6HzutYgeSMbmursUw.text: I feel my review may be a little unfair because I didn't actually order anything when I went there...but I'll do what I can.  The staff:  It's a wine bar.  I'm not asking for experienced Somms but you know an inexperienced one when you see one.  I wouldn't suggest die hard wine lovers come to this place...I think it's for a more relaxed sipper.  The hostess/sommelier/waitress/eye candy girl was very nice.  I think the rule is though, you don't pour your own wine, but the guys I was with were really left with no choice.  She didn't come back for a while.  It wasn't a busy night...maybe she could tell we were bored..  The goods:  Their water was fantastic!  Seriously that's all I ordered.  My friends seemed to enjoy the bottle of Riesling they ordered (shame I didn't share it with them, Riesling is my favorite), and I had a sip of some Desert Blood thing.  Not too bad.  The atmosphere:  I was really confused.  I expected a modern almost futuristic design but it seemed like it was a cross between a hookah lounge complete with Indian lanterns and a pub, squishy leather loveseats included.  I definitely want to give it another shot, maybe pull everything I can out of the experience.  But until then, I'm afraid this is all I've got.

F86SYMnTfhlIVONfIT2YTw.text: Love the chill lounge vibe in this place.  Great spot for a quick drink before a movie, Happy Hour, &/or casual date.  The cocktails were perfect & the service was great!  We'll be coming back here to further explore the drink menu & tapas.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour!
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check out the Calico Brown Ale from Tenaya Creek - local brewers
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whiskey cocktail &amp; Hendrix Cucumber Martini

zNgH9zhBptXJU2J2NyoPIw.text: I met the lovely Chastine V. and Megan M. here for drinks after work. I was, as usual, running late so by the time I arrive it was the last few minutes of happy hour (which is from 3:30-7:30pm) and the other ladies already had drinks and placed a food order.   I didn't like that the happy hour specials were not more clearly indicated. The waitress rattled off what my options were and waited for me to select. When I go to a new place for the first time, I like to check out all my options before deciding on something but I suppose that's what I get for being late.    I ended up getting a Stella since it was the happy hour beer. I know, ordering a beer at a wine bar? Not really my style but the wines that were on special didn't appeal to me. I was disappointed when the waitress brought back a bottle of Stella and said the tap had just run out. Bottled beer is not the same as beer from the tap, but at least it was half price.  I didn't bother ordering food because again, the items that were half price simply did not appeal to me and the items that did appeal to me seemed pricey. Service was ok, our waitress seemed a bit spacey when it came time to split our bill but it could have been a lot worse.   Will I be back? That I am really not sure of, Town Square has places I have enjoyed drinking at more then Double Helix. .. Maybe if I am already there and craving a glass of Merlot....

FKFSzzhTCjPT3ztckShlbQ.text: Great spot in the middle of Town Square that offers a very cool vibe. I would suggest the Arancini risotto fritters with marscapone and roasted mushroom with white truffle aioli...yummy! We also enjoyed the BBQ pork sliders with a glass of Pinot Noir. A great place to go and gather or maybe just looking to have a romantic evening with your loved one.

gpQB5jxBjK4lOiKmLB9RRQ.text: My wife and I, along with our family and friends came here after our wedding last month. The place is cool, and decorated very stylish. The menu is creative and the food is good. They offer bottomless champagne in assorted flavors, all were good. There is a great vibe here, and the service is well above average. After all that being said, the best part is how friendly everybody is. Every employee treated us like they were the owner, and we were the most important guests they ever had. The whole experience was great, and they made our special day, even more special.

Ps3wSjjVw2HIt6HdbAvbGQ.text: Great selection of whiskey and yummy bites for happy hour. I tried to the pork sliders. My friend had the Quesadilla with chorizo and said it was tasty! They have an outdoor patio with misters. This place is a bit underrated and unknown in Town square. I highly recommend it! I wish I took a picture of my sliders, but by the time it crossed my mind my plate was empty.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My girls and I enjoying drinks at happy hour
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What was left of my pork sliders

_ztoVorxKbzghCsRKBb_gg.text: Updating my review of this place and taking it down a star.   Came here last night for happy hour. Love the atmosphere and the drink offerings, but the food, not so much.   Got the vegan tacos, hummus plate, and fries.   Vegan tacos - lettuce wrap style with couscous, baked chic peas, and slice of avocado. Very tasteless. Almost broke a tooth on the chic peas. They were way way too hard for consumption. I ended up pawning mine off on a hungry co-worker. I don't need the dental bill the next day. I imagine these are better on another day!  Our waitress was a little slow last night. She was super nice and friendly, but the place was packed. I don't want to blame her for this, I'm chalking it up to the management staff to put more boots on the ground. I think I only saw about two girls taking orders, the rest were food runners.  Possibly will update this in the future. I do love this place. It's where I met my better half, so it holds a special place in my heart.

S-agyYPtOcXPzVbGY3cEKA.text: Amazing selection of cocktails!  My chef friend recommends  Blood and sand Penicillin  The mad men old fashioned  For cocktails The food is beautifully plated just as the cocktails are

nl8ZS8RM8LplIMngvFDHkw.text: Had a great time at the Double Helix. Awesome Whisk(e)y selection. Our server was very accommodating when a selection from the (Kamikaze) flight I ordered was unavailable. She swapped for another whiskey I wanted to try. Great service, nice atmosphere/vibe, good food. Solid experience all around.

GbKsWZL6cwO-9r-W8oeaIg.text: Our servant was Deborah, very friendly girl (works only in the WE there). We had the double triple (31.49 dollar) which was delicious ! Loved the crispi Yellowfin Tuna (9.49 dollar). The carafe sangria was 14 dollar, but unfortunately, that was no Spanish sangria at all.....  We ordered a standard mojito (11 dollar) and a glass Chianti (9 dollar).  Great place to be, very comfortable to sit. Menu is limited.

DYj9ecALvDeCjoclaY4JXA.text: The place is very expensive for what you get!  We came here on Valentine's Day hoping to be WOWed. And it was just, okay. The sliders were decent sized, and said they came with fries, but ours didn't come with any! We were able to sit outside near the fire and I really liked the atmosphere. Other than that, it's just a regular place to eat that I feel is too over priced.

hA3UakOf7wKMLQUwonpeOA.text: I am in town for my birthday and I was looking for a really good glass of wine.   I searched Yelp and found this place.   Based on the reviews of the staff (mostly) and the food I decided to try it.    I wish the before mentioned staff would have been on duty while I was there.    Since I am not from the area I needed to rely on the staff for wine selection.  My waitress's only suggestion for wine was the MOST expensive at $21 for 5 ounces.   $350 per bottle.  It was good,  but still...  It seemed that she didn't really know the wine. Or care.  The arancini was as reviewed.   Worth going back for.  The patio was comfortable back yard patio furniture.   It was difficult to catch my waitress to pay as I had a show ticket.   Otherwise,  she and the other staff provided decent service.

thVSMrIA5hVFqbRMjT_epA.text: Phenomenal drinks, Phenomenal food, Phenomenal service & Phenomenal atmosphere! A great date spot/ hidden gem. Delicious wine & charcuterie selection. Wines and whiskeys from all over the world hand selected. The GM is magnificent. Also a lovely cigar selection and one of the only dog friendly patios in las vegas. Love this place to pieces.

wpFP-LKZ5NUQrr39ShWOZg.text: Cigar lounge that doesn't serve cigars.  They report something wrong with the humidor but can't sell what's in It. No advanced communication when we called to inquire. 20 minute drive for nothing!

nhIETy-j7rJ9nGlqmoA2pQ.text: I work in the vicinity of Double Helix. They have a wonderful selection of wine and whiskies. Their servers are impeccable and we always seem to get the same lady (cute Asian girl) hat rushes our orders brings us drinks and separates our checks like a master.  If I were ever to commit a crime you'll find me taking their wine glasses and light fixtures. They're beautiful, don't judge me.  Any place that carries the Mollydooker Shiraz gets my vote every day. I've managed to drool over my friends choices of food and have yet to have a bad meal here.  I've personally tried the lobster rolls with are presented on a garlic puff pastry which is simply amazing. Their meatballs are deliciously prepared and come with garlic knots that I'm willing to turn a blind eye to the carbs that I'm ingesting.  I am jealous of my friend's salmon sliders. I'm kicking myself for not ordering them because they're nice portion of salmon fillet with a tapenade aioli. I've finally eaten them and they are as tasty as they are to look at.  On a final note, I want their wine glasses. They are a nice size, delicate and beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their bartenders are pretty cool too
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grown up grilled cheese with Gruyere and Black Forest ham
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ardbeg, my favorite Scotch. Peety and smokey

i4UwtOppeiqBNiGnOiM3uw.text: The whiskey selection is one of the best I've seen! It's one of my favorite local spots to stop by at whenever I'm meeting my friends. The fire pit is so comfortable to relax by too

H6XPLeop2daAkBIYKY4u8Q.text: Very nice and relaxing place to lounge around with your friends. The decor was trendy with really artsy lamps.  We came here for happy hour and I'm so glad we did! I ordered the sangria and it was delicious! Full of fruits and the rim of the cup is dipped in cinnamon. We also ordered a few bites to snack on. I especially love the fried truffle risotto balls! Yummy and so addicting!   Service was prompt and accommodating! I will be back when I'm in town again!

kqcqTSPf7O_mbF2vyRzCeg.text: Sciencey name? Whiskey? How could I resist? Great staff, knew their whiskey, happy to talk about it. Extensive list with some more interesting options for the enthusiasts. I like that it ran deep in both whiskey and wine, because that's sometimes a problem with groups that have a mixed but strong preference for one of the other. Food was surprisingly good (had charcuterie and skirt steak) I had originally come to the barbecue place around the corner, but it was weirdly empty, and the Yard House just seemed a little too chain restaurant for me. I think I made the right decision - this seems like the best in the area.

ihaAwyBi3EJH-Jfe2PBu8Q.text: I really loved it here! Nice adult hangout. You can eat and drink inside or outside; I'd suggest the patio area though, way more chill, plus you can smoke while people watching. It really just gave me the feeling of being at home on your patio/backyard and just hanging out with your friends while having a drink and a smoke. No rushed feelings of eating at a restaurant, just really nice and comfortable. The service was really good, very helpful, and the food was also good. I enjoyed my wines, I ordered a muscat and port; I love a place that gives the option of these two types of wines, even though I drink other types but these are really sweet and sometimes I'm just craving sweet. They had a pretty good wine selection, some nice California wineries(Napa, Paso Robles etc), some very familiar ones. As for the smoking, the cigars, I could really tell you nothing about it cause I'm not a smoker but I did see on the menu lots of different varieties, I'm sure you smokers will find some you really like. Anyway this is a place I have to come back to when in Vegas, trust me you'll love it too!

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1MtIAzI4TAJojmUIANX-cA.text: This is a little gem in Town Square. Great selection of bourbon and scotch with a knowledgeable staff to guide you if you are new to the whiskey world. It cozy and friendly, plus a great patio that is cigar-friendly. We were headed somewhere else but liked it so much we stayed!

uTVGG90zDBPhNPv9Jc0pEw.text: A home run!!   Off the beaten path (for the most part), Double Helix offers happy hour every day from 3:30-7:30! There are wonderful wine selections including wine flights and unique things on the happy hour menu, not just what ever they need to get rid of.   The owner / manager, has a great pallet and the pairings are fantastic! We ordered mostly munchies, but they were all good! The bartender, Kyle, makes a MEAN Manhattan! Their whiskey selection is extensive and among the best I've seen in one restaurant. There are also whisky flights available so you can try a few different ones.   They have an outdoor patio and smoking area so that you can partake in the cigar selection they have inside. While it isn't the most expansive selection I've come across, it is descent and was perfect for a casual evening out on the patio.   The atmosphere inside and out is perfect! Outside chairs are comfortable, the fires are nice in the winter. The patio lights are well distributed and provide for that perfect ambiance. Inside the lights are dim and the decor is chic and trendy, but casual and inviting.   Above all, the service was outstanding! We've been back twice now and had the same experience. This is one of my FAVORITE places in Vegas. It isn't showy, it just has substance!

ZT9k6WlAL_uQkFTnexwfcw.text: Went here for the first time last night & it was fantastic.  Service: Everyone was very attentive. Our bartender Kyle was very knowledgeable about the drinks and dishes that he suggested, and my friend and I really enjoyed talking to him.  Food: My friend and I shared 7 dishes that were all delicious. We had the aracini, lobster tacos, seared yellowfin, prosciutto, smoked duck (twice), crime brulee cheesecake, and triple chocolate mousse. They were all very delicious, however the prosciutto was definitely on the overly salty side; wished there was at least some fruit or mild cheese to balance it out.  Drinks: My friend and I both got the Whisky mule. Loved the flavors & loved it even more when Kyle suggested making the mule with their featured half-off Canadian whisky.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Triple chocolate mousse &amp; crime brûlée cheesecake
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prosciutto
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tacos

OfijGySrWwjAMAlt8nwidQ.text: Loved the atmosphere of this place, great for drinks and appetizers.  Reserved the fire pit outside, great time. Staid warm and great service.

Kh2kFOrDqdUA_g7nSZYfhw.text: Really terrible service - server was clueless. Took an hour and a half to get a salad.

rerw3-tflvfHfo7qb9U2Ew.text: Double Helix - one of my favorite spots in Vegas. They are a very nice wine bar. They have a great happy hour. Have been there quite a few times with hubby and friends.   Definitely taken advantage of their awesome happy hour from 3:30p - 7:30p. Great prices starting at $4 wines. Their appetizers are amazing for the pallet. Their Anachini balls in truffle sauce are on a whole other level. I love their resling wine as well.   They have inside and outside seating. I love the decor. The outside patio has a comfy setting you can feel at home. Great place to take friends. Even just to grab a quick wine or beer before a bigger dinner or a movie at AMC.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fire pit outside
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Funny!
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken chorizo quesadilla

Rk7tyjhxv5SvrzLZevexTw.text: Fun, tasty place to hang out. The outdoor seating looked popular and had lots of young adults.  A friend and I were able to go to Happy Hour (3:30 - 7:30) and tried a few tapas- From the HH: Arancini: The best dish we got. Crispy and delicious risotto inside with a savory truffle aioli to dip them in. I could've ordered ten of these plates.  Olive poppers: Not a fan of olives, and these were just alright. Salty & tasted like a tortino's pizza roll. Would skip next time. BBQ Sliders: Meat was well seasoned, but with the slaw, tasted oddly burnt.. wasn't horrible. We also ordered the Whisky Mule and Southern Sipping (more on the sweet side, but less fruity than we had hoped).  Not from the HH, we had the Grown up Grilled Cheese which was good. Soft and cheesy on the inside and out. Prosciutto plate was overly salty as well.. the meat is salty to begin with but with the sauce added, was too much.  Service was nice and food came out quickly, so I can't complain. Would return for the drinks and arancini, but not the other menu items I tried.

96dVmBo_1nd5ELUD7w5UFg.text: I LOVED the atmosphere and the food! My husband and I ordered the mushroom ravioli, margarita flatbread (which was half off special for Sunday, in addition to $4 glasses of Rose), skirt steak, and sweet potato fries. Everything was delicious!  It is located at the bottom of the stairs for the AMC Theatres, which was a perfect spot for our late night food cravings.   I hope to visit in the future to try some of their cheeses and possibly one of their whisky flights.

TosHP_H7TehdHNvpYvYblQ.text: I had been looking forward to trying this place for awhile.  My husband and I finally got a date night and stopped in to try it out.  We sat down at the bar and the bartender was on the phone looking like he was in the middle of fixing something.  We waited, another bartender went around and took the order of another group.  We waited.  By then there were 3 bartenders there and not once we're we greeted , not once did they say we will be right with you, they didn't even look at us. We got up and left.  It's a shame as we were ready for a good night out.  We didn't come for just a drink, we were ready to spend some time and money there.  Instead we went to another bar and spent our money there. We won't be going back.

CoSgrfYir2h3pi30ugOO3Q.text: A great spot in Town Square that I visit frequently!   Double Helix is a small but very welcoming bar. There's couch, table, and bar seating available inside. There's also seating outdoors and a rectangular fire pit.  Their happy hour is from 3:30p-7:30p with discounted wine, beer, whiskey and appetizers. I love going on Mondays rather than during happy hour because they have 1/2 off bottles of wine all day. I go and enjoy my favorite Pinot Noir Meoimi for $20! Tuesdays they have 20% off the final bill for all industry locals and Wednesdays it's 1/2 off featured whiskey and wine of the month. I also like going on Wednesdays to broaden my whiskey horizon. Having great daily specials makes Double Helix that much better.   I don't care for their menu items but I do like their custom charcuterie tray which pairs perfectly with wine. It can get a little pricy adding in all the different meats and cheeses you want.   The bartenders and servers are all very friendly. Jess is one of the bartenders and she is absolutely phenomenal! We love going when she's working. She's quick and always engages with us.   Love this place for the wine, whiskey, and fun ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You can never go wrong with Meiomi
Photo of Double Helix Wine & Whiskey Lounge - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meiomi and a charcuterie tray of goodies

Ig3f6dFka-LqiAK7JMtILg.text: Great happy hour! My friend & I wanted to meet for happy hour & she suggested this place. Good call, Heidi!  Bartender was very patient as my friend sampled the happy hour wines trying to decide on a favorite. I went with the malbec right away and was pretty happy with it.  I tried to be good and ordered the gluten free appetizer, Seared Yellowfin Tuna. It was really good and at happy hour prices, it was a steal. But then I got weak.... And had to order the Grown Up Grilled cheese. It was adorable. I ordered it sans pork (allergy) and it was really good.   My friend ordered the Olive poppers, but I couldn't try them (also had pork) this place is very pork friendly. I don't think she expected them to be breaded & deep fried. She also ordered the Salmon Caesar salad. It was very big & looked delicious! She said she liked it.   I'm definitely coming back to try some other stuff, if I can keep from ordering the Grown Up Grilled Cheese, that is... Try it!
